title: Designer
description: Who is Prosek?We are entrepreneurial. Prosek is one of the largest independent communications and marketing firms in the UK and U.S., with offices and strategic partners across the country and worldwide. Prosek provides unparalleled expertise with financial and professional services companies. We are people-centric. Our teams work together in a collegial atmosphere that breeds professional respect and friendship. We are award-winning. Join an "Army of Entrepreneurs" that was recently named 2021 Corporate/Financial Agency of the Year by PRovoke Media..Overview:Prosek Partners is seeking a talented, versatile and motivated full-time designer to join our growing creative services team.The position will be primarily responsible for creating and developing original concepts for websites, brand visual identity systems and marketing collateral. Along with these tasks, the professional we seek will also lead and/or be a key participant in the creation of strategies for both our clients and internal stakeholders, and work on a variety of other projects collaborating with team members throughout our offices in New York, Connecticut, Boston, Washington D.C., Los Angeles, Palm Beach, London, and South Africa.What you'll be doing:Translate ideas, end-user needs, design criteria, and technical features into quality designsSpeak not just passionately about your work but also plainly to those who are inexperiencedExercise a strong grasp of storytelling through layout and information designIf applicable, mentoring junior designers who will support the projects you leadUtilizing best-in-class tools and technologies to realize clients' visionsManage project timelines, key stakeholders, and time management effectively What makes you qualified: 2-5 years of professional design-related experience. Bachelor's degree in design or related fieldAble to design across a range of media including digital, mobile-first and print - bonus points going to those candidates who can demonstrate experience with motion design and/or codingPossess excellent written and verbal communication skillsBe comfortable with receiving, understanding, and giving feedbackCritically analyze and execute on a supplied creative direction Be flexible and passionate about collaborating with other designers Able to work under tight deadlinesBe self-motivated, detail-oriented and confidentCapable of analyzing challenges and create on-brand design solutions that meet measurable business goals and requirementsProficient within Figma and Adobe Creative Cloud tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesignExperience prototyping and creating design systems, component libraries, and visual identity guides within Figma a plus Excellent typography and iconography knowledge-base and skill(s). Ability to create work inspired by ideas and innovative concepts, not trends Knowledge and experience working with CMS platforms such as WordPressWhat are the perks?401(k) employer match: There is no time like the present to prepare for your future!Premium healthcare plans, including medical, dental and vision coverage: Your health comes first. Hybrid work model: 2 days in the office, 3 days from home - Pick your own schedule. 2 weeks of remote work per year: You do you!Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) package including birthday PTO and 6 "It's Ok" days: Enjoy life's moments. Custom career opportunities - Choose your own adventure!Our Core Values:Chemistry, Collaboration and Belonging: Our collegial culture inspires people with different perspectives and backgrounds to work towards common goals as we brainstorm, plan and execute on behalf of our clients and to build our business together. Grit and Hustle: We work hard. We roll up our sleeves. We are not precious or pretentious. We do not take short cuts. Instead, we put in the work and do what it takes to get the job done. The Excitement of New Challenges: We view challenges as opportunities and embrace them. They motivate us to learn and grow so that we can be the best versions of ourselves, for our clients and each other. A Workplace with Humanity: We recognize the rigor and demand of our work. We also recognize that life inside and outside of Prosek can be stressful. We work very hard to run our business with a heavy dose of humanity and to make Prosek a safe place where people enjoy the work and each other. Our Beliefs on Culture, Diversity & Belonging:We are committed to building a diverse workforce reflecting and embracing diversity of all kinds - race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, political affiliation, socioeconomic backgrounds. We believe having teams that represent the broader communities where we live and work creates a culture that celebrates creativity, inclusiveness and teamwork and helps us offer our global clientele of mature and emerging businesses counsel that is dynamic, rich and nuanced.The anticipated salary range for this position is $65,000-$90,000. An employee's salary is determined by a range of factors including but not limited to relevant experience, qualifications, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, and business or organizational needs. The range listed is one component of Prosek's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include medical, dental and vision coverage, 401(k) matching, new business commission, paid time off, and other benefits.Prosek Partners provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Product Designer, Enterprise
description: About UsWe're on a mission to make it possible for every person, team, and company to be able to tailor their software to solve any problem and take on any challenge. Computers may be our most powerful tools, but most of us can't build or modify the software we use on them every day. At Notion, we want to change this with focus, design, and craft.We've been working on this together since 2016, and have customers like Pixar, Mitsubishi, Figma, Plaid, Match Group, and thousands more on this journey with us. Today, we're growing fast and excited for new teammates to join us who are the best at what they do. We're passionate about building a company as diverse and creative as the millions of people Notion reaches worldwide.Notion is an in person company, and currently requires its employees to come to the office for two Anchor Days (Mondays & Thursdays) and requests that employees spend the majority of their week in the office (including a third day).About The RoleImagine yourself in the 1970s or 80s thinking through how computing should look and feel for people who had never seen one before. That's what we're trying to do at Notion — make software that feels timeless, with the craftsmanship of German cameras, playfulness of Japanese toys, and mass appeal of Coca-Cola. We have no end of fascinating challenges that can only be solved by someone with innate product & UX sense, technical aptitude, great taste, and impeccable craft.What You'll AchieveDesign product concepts that balance vision, craft, speed, and business potential.Craft every detail of new product features, from idea to UX to pixel-perfect execution.Run projects end to end with engineers to drive your vision to the ship line.Partner closely with our Customer Experience, Sales, and Customer Success teams to understand what each of our diverse user segments need, want, and love about Notion. Use this data and acquired intuition to prioritize, plan, and scope our product roadmap.Work with Marketing to devise new ways to tell great stories throughout the user lifecycle, and across our site, product, help guides and other channels.Create new patterns that are intuitive, practical, and convergent. Evolve our design system intentionally as we scale.Skills You'll Need To BringYou have 4+ years of experience building end to end administration oriented experiences for Enterprise SaaS solutions (security, user access management, compliance, auditing and monitoring, etc)You understand and care deeply about user personas like IT decision makers, IT Admins, SecOps, CISOs, and their unique needs.You are familiar with the problem space and how customers will use the product. You design using best practices and advocate for the best user experience.You care about business needs, implications, and the practicality of your solutions and work to deliver clear, intuitive, and appealing human interfaces that blend seamlessly into the Notion UI.You have strong beliefs, loosely held. You're a good listener who collaborates well with different stakeholders. You observe and internalize all inputs and feedback to help you reach an optimal decision.You understand how to tell stories using both words and visuals, and strategize the best ways to drive alignment.You value working cross-functionally with project management, engineering, research and data — as well as design peers.Nice To HavesYou've designed and built great tools with small teams in the past.You bring unique strengths and perspectives to the team. We're looking to build a diverse team where our skills and experience can complement each other.You've experienced the pain of fragmented tools and information silos created by them, and have a strong urge to fix it.You're familiar with the work of computing heroes like Douglas Engelbart, Alan Kay, Bret Victor, etc. — and understand why we're big fans.You are a designer who can code!We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our global employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers. If you’re excited about a role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you’re a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making software toolmaking ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.Notion is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Notion considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Notion is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.Notion is committed to providing highly competitive cash compensation, equity, and benefits. The compensation offered for this role will be based on multiple factors such as location, the role’s scope and complexity, and the candidate’s experience and expertise, and may vary from the range provided below. For roles based in San Francisco and New York City, the estimated base salary range for this role is $105,000 - $260,000 per year.

title: Graphic Designer
description: McBride Homes has an exciting opportunity for a Graphic Designer & Marketing Coordinator to join our marketing team. McBride is Missouri's largest homebuilder and is an industry leader in residential new home construction. We have built over 35,000 homes across the St. Louis area and have been in business over 75 years. We are seeking a detail-oriented, creative and tech savvy candidate to create various graphic design projects and collaborate with the marketing team for all promotional activities. This is an in-office position located in our new state-of-the-art facility in Chesterfield Valley.Graphic Designer/Marketing Coordinator will work closely with the marketing team and executive leadership to conceptualize and create marketing materials using graphic design, digital advertising, social media, and printed materials.Responsibilities include:Design and update graphic materials for corporate office and new home communities including signage, billboards, ads, flyers, brochures, direct mail, and other collateral materials.Coordinate, design and help manage content for all digital content including website copy, blog posts, press releases, and electronic newsletters.Create and implement social media campaigns on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.Actively participate in team brainstorming/concept development sessions.Adhere to project deadlines and provide status updates on a regular basis to management.Contribute to team effort by helping with other projects as needed.Requirements include:Bachelor's degree in graphic design, marketing, or related field.3 to 5 years of related work experience.Strong expertise in Creative Suite including Adobe In-Design, Illustrator, and Photoshop.Excellent Microsoft Office skills (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel).Experience creating web graphics and some knowledge of HTML/CSS.Additional preferred skills in key areas of marketing (SEO, social media, content marketing, email marketing, PPC and SEM).Proficient with typography and design layout.Excellent writing skills with experience in copywriting and editing.Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities, while demonstrating strong attention to detail and appreciation of deadlines is essential.McBride offers competitive compensation: $55,000-$65,000/yr. (depending on experience) and an annual bonus program. We also provide an outstanding benefits package, including, health, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance benefits, a 401(k) plan with matching contribution, paid vacation, an onsite fitness center, and the opportunity to work in a collaborative and entrepreneurial work environment.McBride is an equal opportunity employer.

title: UI/UX Designer
description: Led by Michael Antonov, the co-founder of Oculus, and well-funded by Formic Ventures, Deep Origin is a software startup poised to reinvent the way scientists work and life science innovations come to life. We see a future largely free of diseases with a 150 year lifespan being a norm. To get there, we are building an operating system for science, enabling scientists to be more productive and to bring tomorrow's ideas to life quickly and at a reasonable cost.We are looking for a talented UI/UX Designer to create amazing user experiences for our SaaS offering. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior UI skills, and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces.This individual will work onsite in our South San Francisco office at least 3 days per week.RequirementsResponsibilities and Duties:Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals, and experienceExecute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineeringConceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user-friendliness to complex design roadblocksCreate wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows, and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideasPresent and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive-level stakeholdersConduct user research and evaluate user feedback to gather insights into user behaviors and attitudesEstablish and promote design guidelines, best practices, and standardsKeep abreast of the latest UI/UX trends, techniques, and technologiesWork with front-end developers to ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designsOptimize existing user interface designsTest for intuitivity and experienceCommunicate with clients to understand their business goals and objectivesDevelop technical and business requirements and always strive to deliver intuitive and user-centered solutionsCombine creativity with an awareness of the design elementsQualifications:Proven UI/UX design experience with a strong portfolioProficiency in Photoshop, Figma, or other visual design and wire-framing toolsProficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for rapid prototypingExcellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interactionAbility to solve problems creatively and effectivelyUp-to-date with the latest UI/UX trends, techniques, and technologiesExperience working with software engineering and product management teamsExcellent communication, presentation, and analytical skillsAbility to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment

title: Associate Product Designer
description: Company DescriptionOrder.co is the first and only Spend Efficiency Platform that helps businesses save time, save money, and gain clarity into their spend. Order.co eliminates manual purchasing and payment tasks and gives your team one place to purchase, approve, track and pay for all the physical goods your business needs. With customizable budgets and reporting, operations and finance teams can take back control over the buying process and start spending efficiently.Founded in 2016 and headquartered in New York City, Order.co oversees spend for hundreds of customers like WeWork, SoulCycle, Lume, and High Level Health. Order.co has raised $50M in funding from industry-leading investors like MIT, Stage 2 Capital, Rally Ventures, 645 Ventures, and more. Order.co has been proudly named as a 50 to Watch by Spend Matters and a Best Place to Work by BuiltIn.Job DescriptionWhy you should get excitedYour work will help our customers solve very real problems that affect their day-to-day. You’ll be empowered to make data-driven decisions by leveraging easily-accessed user behavior data. We hire experts in their craft; we’re eager to leverage your experience, feedback and ideas!You’ll be able to contribute to and leverage our brand new design system, Zest. You’ll have opportunities for career growth, cross-functional exposure, and personal development via collaboration and mentorship from a talented team of Product Managers, Engineering Leads, and Order.co’s Lead Product DesignerWe offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that is supportive of fully-remote team members. ResponsibilitiesPartner closely with product and engineering to design and launch products that will help our customers make smarter purchasing decisions for their businessDevelop a deep understanding of the purchasing and payment needs of businesses that are rapidly scalingContribute to systems and processes (like our design system) to help us scaleWork alongside our Lead Product Designer, Product Managers, and Lead Marketing Designer to collaboratively break down open-ended opportunities into meaningful next steps and find new opportunities for work that span across our organizational boundariesWork across pre-purchase, post-purchase, and payment experiences as well as more technical spaces, bringing the needs of our customers with you as you exploreHelp shape the culture of our growing design team that’s central to our company’s growth strategyQualificationsFormal education in User Experience or Product Design OR at least 1 year of UX job experienceYou have a passion for user research and the human-centered design processYou’re an action-oriented systems-thinker, who loves building simple and elegant user experiences that consider every facet of the user journey You’re an effective communicator and collaborator who loves complex business areasYou thrive when simplifying complex workflows via elegant designYou are organized, have a bias for action, and are able to ruthlessly prioritize and execute according to individual and company goalsYou are passionate about great design moving the needle on tangible business metrics Alongside your resume, please provide web-based work examples or a separate portfolio document highlighting experience in UX design Additional InformationWhat You’ll ReceiveA competitive compensation package including stock optionsRobust medical, dental, vision, and wellness benefitsFlexible time off and remote work policiesEmployer-sponsored 401(k)The anticipated annual base salary range for this role is $90,000-$110,000 Actual compensation and title will be commensurate with experience, qualifications, knowledge, and skills. Order.co is an equal opportunity employer. Applicant's qualifications are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by law.#BI-Remote

title: UX/UI Designer
description: Company Intro:Our world is immersive and visceral. Content today is static and boring. We are Momenti, video that you interact with, bringing visceral experiences to all content. Build deeper connections and emotions with multi-dimensional video, and bring life to content by breaking the 4th wall. Join the content revolution! The world is alive, and so should your captured moments. Momenti is here.Responsibilities:Design user interfaces for mobile applications, including creating wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes.Develop user experience plans for mobile apps, including user research, usability testing, user story mapping, and task flows.Collaborate with product and engineering teams to ensure product goals are met.Create visual designs that follow the latest design trends.Develop user-friendly navigation structures and information architectures.Stay up-to-date on the latest mobile trends and technologies.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in design or a related field.At least 4 years of experience in UI/UX design for mobile applications.Excellent understanding of mobile UI/UX best practices.Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch and Figma.Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

title: UI/UX Designer
description: SiteZeus is seeking a talented UI/UX Designer to join our dynamic team. As a UI/UX Designer, you will play a critical role in shaping the user experience of our platforms. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing intuitive and user-friendly interfaces for our web applications. You will work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and leverage your knowledge of user-centered design to create elegant and efficient solutions. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with developers to ensure seamless integration of your designs.The ideal candidate should have a strong portfolio demonstrating their ability to design effective user interfaces and experiences. They should be skilled in UX research, wireframing, prototyping, and visual design. The candidate should also have a solid understanding of current design trends and be able to incorporate them into their work.If you have a passion for user-centered design, are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and thrive in a collaborative team setting, then we would love to hear from you. Come join us and help shape the future of SiteZeus!Expected Salary Range: $90,000 - $100,000This is a remote (work from home) position.Position Responsibilities:Translate the Product Owner’s vision and user stories into a visual representation for project stakeholders and developers to see how a feature should look.Conducting user research and testing to gather insights and identify user needs and pain points.Creating wireframes, prototypes, and visual designs for our web applications.Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of designs.Developing and maintaining design guidelines and standards.Conducting design reviews and providing feedback to other designers.Staying up to date with current design trends and technologies.Conducting usability testing to evaluate the effectiveness of designs.Iterating designs based on user feedback and testing results.Contributing to the overall design strategy and vision of the company.Ensure that the user experience will be intuitive and easy to learn for end users.Ensure that the page designs are responsive to different screen device sizes.Skills & Requirements:5+ years of UI/UX design experience.Has a strong desire to provide the best possible user experience to delight customers.Strong portfolio showcasing skills in user-centered design, information architecture, and visual design.Proficiency Adobe Creative Suite, in particular, XD & Figma.Knowledge of design principles, including typography, color theory, and composition.Experience conducting user research and testing.Ability to create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups.Understanding of front-end development languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.Ability to be self-directed and work independently, as well as collaboratively as part of an Agile Scrum Product Team to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals, and experience.Ability to identify problems and strategize solutions to remedy problems.Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices, and standards.Up to date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies.Excellent organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects at once.Superior attention to detail and follow-through.Preferred:Bachelor's or Master's degree in design, human-computer interaction, or a related field. Ability to translate prototypes to workable UI in Vue.js.Experience with Visual Studio Code, Git, and Azure DevOps.Local to Tampa for occasional in-office business.BenefitsOption to work from home, from our Tampa office, or both (for select positions)Unlimited PTO that we encourage you to use *Flexible work hours401(k); health, vision, dental, and legal insurance; and other traditional benefits *Paid parental leave *Paid monthly community service time *Paid company summitsWellness programs to make your work-life balance better than everEquity gaining opportunities after one year of employment (based on performance) *Monthly incentive opportunities for meeting sales goals (This is in addition to listed compensation) For Full Time EmployeesCore ValuesGrit - Find a way to solve problems and overcome adversity.Candidly Coachable - Be direct yet empathetic with your team members.Urgency - Act with a high sense of urgency.Team Mentality - Put the team's needs ahead of your own.Unicorn - Be exceptional in the pursuit of your craft.Hiring ProcessWe will reach out or send a rejection notice to most candidates within one to five business days of their application submission. SiteZeus promises professionalism and respect for your time in every step of the process.Quick screening with our HR specialistInterview with the hiring managerGroup interview with team membersFinal interview with executive leadershipAbout UsSiteZeus is an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity, culture, and the human experience. We go above and beyond to ensure that all team members feel comfortable about who they are and the contributions they make to our mission. Our team is highly encouraged to find a balance that allows for optimal fulfillment at work and home.All applicants must be legally authorized to work within the United States. All roles may require corporate communication skills and prolonged periods of sitting at a desk or working on a computer. Degree requirements and preferences may be substituted for bona fide work history or relevant experience.Powered by JazzHRnrP9ogM9KC

title: Content Designer
description: Content designers at Meta craft simple, straightforward and human experiences. Approaching design through the lens of language, we leverage our expertise in user experience design, design thinking and product strategy. Come join our team to create and shape great, intuitive products and services used by billions of people around the world every day.You’ll be expected to design and deliver product flows, new features, in-product language, content frameworks, navigation, product naming and more, for platforms including mobile, desktop, AR/VR, hardware and voice. The Meta Content Design team is one of the largest and most established in the world, and includes people at various stages in their careers and from a range of backgrounds.Content Designer Responsibilities:Design, write, edit and test clear, compelling in-product language to help users and teams meet their goals. This includes product flows, interface language, education materials, product names, navigational nomenclature, terminology, taxonomies and other content across Meta products and experiences.Apply systems thinking to the product, whether it’s defining extensible design system guidance, conducting audits of existing experiences or creating information architecture.Use your familiarity with how code works in software. This may involve doing things like reviewing code to ensure the in-product language is as intended, or creating the logic to personalize the experience for a user.Give and solicit feedback from your UX design peers in service of building the best products.Create or contribute to high-fidelity design mocks using Figma.Collaborate daily with peers across disciplines, including engineering, design, research, marketing and data science, to take products from conception to launch.Partner with our internationalization team to ensure product experiences are of the highest quality in every language.Demonstrate sound judgment and help shape product narratives, along with team direction and strategy.Independently and proactively identify and work on projects that span multiple teams.Minimum Qualifications:Experience in simplifying and communicating complex ideas to broad audiences in a compelling way.5+ years’ experience in UX writing.Examples of finished wireframes, or design mocks co-authored using design tools, that have been used to drive decision-making within a team.Familiarity with tools for managing and updating content at scale.Examples of work in design systems and systems thinking.Demonstrated experience leading projects with minimal direction and handling a large degree of ambiguity.About Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

title: Product Designer (UX/UI)
description: About AxacraftAxacraft is driven to challenge traditional digital transformation approaches. We're the first global digital transformation agency that wants to transform traditional consulting approaches while preparing our clients for an increasingly digital future.After twenty years of working with big consulting, we knew something had to change. We didn't see alignment between expensive strategy presentations and the way high-performance product teams work. Most digital strategy recommendations aren't agile and are only barely actionable. The reason is that the people making the strategy aren't builders themselves.We are product people who speak business. We are strategists who believe in winning in the weeds and doing the work. And we are looking for product people alike to expand the team.-> We are looking for full-time and part-time. Learn more about our culture: https://www.axacraft.com/about/axacraft-cultureJob OverviewWe are seeking an experienced Product designer with strong UX/UI skillsWe are looking for a professional who can create complex user flowsThe work might range from enterprise software to responsive web apps, design systems, etcWe are looking for a professional who can convert ideas into products and go from wireframes to prototypesWe value velocity. Our teams are listening, thinking, and moving fastResponsibilitiesLeverage a human-centered design process to deliver an easy-to-use user interface and user experienceDevelop personas, scenarios, and user storiesWork with the product team and/or stakeholders to identify requirementsCreate wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mock-upsCreate and maintain usability documentationWork with developers to ensure product qualityWork closely with product managers and marketing to maximize customer successEnsure products are tested with customers and validated against business goalsDeliver polished interface screens and logical user journeysRequirementsWorking knowledge of UX design principlesUser interface designFigmaWireframing/prototypingExperience with design systems, dashboards, and complex user flowsExperience with creating components and auto layoutsExperience working in a product teamBenefitsWhat We Offer:Competitive compensationBest in class software/toolsWe’re a team that moves fast and ships new products continuously. We attract high talented, cross-functional people who together create a thriving environment to work and play. Our culture is defined but it’s not definitive, and we’re looking for smart, hardworking and passionate people to be culture adds at Axacraft. No politicsYou have the opportunity to work with a team of best-in-class strategists, business and product people who create beautiful productsWe champion individual ownership, self-starters, and personal growth on and off the job. We’re a tight knit team that celebrates each other’s wins and improves one another through the losses

title: UI/UX Designer
description: REMOTE, EST onlyNeed portfolio. bio-pharma exp is needed. Need LinkedInThe Contract, UI/UX Business Analyst & Designer is responsible for the execution of the overall strategy, as defined by the IT Leadership, and the development and enforcement of UI/UX design standard across both custom applications and line of business platforms. This includes, but may not be limited to, gathering and evaluating requirements from stakeholders, using various means to illustrate design ideas, designing UI elements such as forms, pages, tabs, widgets and menus, and inculcating UX best practices across all user interfaces.The incumbent leads and contributes to ensuring consistent design standards across all custom application user interfaces. This involves identifying, documenting, and refining business and system requirements based on dialogue and interaction with end users, as well as the Associate Director. Upon finalization of these requirements, designs appropriate UI elements and makes UX recommendations that meet the specified business needs as per project/action plan(s) to ensure solutions are implemented on schedule.The Contract, UI/UX Business Analyst & Designer is the primary point of contact between end users and the stakeholders. They will also contribute subject matter expertise and provide mentorship and training to end users and IT team members.The Contract, UI/UX Business Analyst & Designer supports adherence to relevant regulatory requirements and all company Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).Job DescriptionESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSPrimary Duties/responsibilitiesIdentifies UI and UX design needs for the company's applications, platforms, and digital assets.Develops and conceptualizes UI/UX design strategies to ensure consistency and best practices.Produces high-quality UI/UX designs using wireframes, flow diagrams, graphic and visual design, sitemaps, prototypes, and storyboards.Designs UI elements, such as search boxes, navigation menus, widgets, and tabs, for the company's applications, platforms, and digital assets using various UI/UX tools.Test UI elements, forms, form elements, page designs, page layouts, target links, and page flows.Collaborate with the Corporate Communications team and internal and external designers to make sure that tailor-made content is being created and delivered to the digital users.Provides advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methods and tests to ensure proper prediction and analysis of user behavior.Functions as an internal UI/UX Subject Matter Expert and recommends best-practice solutions.Performs other tasks and assignments as needed and specified by management.Knowledge/Skills/Abilities RequiredProven work experience as a UI/UX designer or a similar role.Portfolio of UI/UX design work for both mobile and web platformsGood knowledge of Sketch, InVision, HTML, Visio, iOS, Android, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.Proficient with visual design programs such as Adobe Photoshop and others.Ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment to create top-performing interfaces for end users.Experience with coding and ability to troubleshoot using HTML, CSS, and comparable languages.Continued education and research into UX trends and current design strategy and technologies.Experience creating storyboards and website mapping. Minimum level of education and years of relevant work experience.Bachelor's degree in a related discipline (e.g. computer science, web design, graphic design, etc.) and a minimum of 6 years of progressively responsible experience in a pharmaceutical, biotechnology or related environment OR equivalent experience.A minimum of 6 years of experience as the principal resource for UI/UX design OR equivalent experience and/or education.

title: UX Designer Pleno - 100% remoto
description: Job DescriptionVocê irá exercer um papel de extrema importância no crescimento da Doc9 Lawtech e de nossos produtos, como UX DESIGNER PLENO no time de Serviços Jurídicos.A Doc9 é uma lawtech, que cresce em ritmo exponencial, com marca consolidada no mercado jurídico, com seus serviços jurídicos, como a realização de audiências, diligências e cálculos. Além disso, possuímos outros dois produtos puramente tecnológicos (Saas): Whom e eHealth.Somos formados por gente inquieta e empreendedora, que valoriza o trabalho em equipe e acredita que o crescimento sustentável se dá a partir de pessoas que amam o que fazem.Estamos em busca de pessoas engajadas, que tenham brilho no olho e muita vontade de se desenvolver e crescer com a gente.Responsibilities and assignmentsColaborar com a equipe de produto, engenheiros e stakeholders para definir requisitos de design e objetivos do projeto;Realizar pesquisas de usuário e análises de mercado para entender as necessidades, preferências e comportamentos dos usuários;Criar wireframes, protótipos interativos e fluxos de usuário para comunicar soluções de design;Realizar testes de usabilidade para validar conceitos e identificar oportunidades de melhoria;Contribuir para a criação e manutenção de uma biblioteca de design consistente e reutilizável;Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com a equipe de desenvolvimento para garantir a implementação precisa dos designs.Requirements And QualificationsPelo menos dois anos de experiência comprovada em design de experiência do usuário;Ser autônomo nas tomadas de decisões;Portfólio sólido que demonstre projetos bem-sucedidos e soluções inovadoras (será necessário enviar dois projetos já desenvolvidos por você para análise dos times de R&S e Técnico);Conhecimento aprofundado de metodologias de pesquisa de usuário e testes de usabilidade;Experiência em criação de wireframes, protótipos e fluxos de usuário;Domínio de ferramentas de design como Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, ou similares;Habilidades de comunicação excepcionais para apresentar e defender suas ideias;Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe e colaborar efetivamente em um ambiente ágil;Conhecimento de princípios de design responsivo e acessibilidade é um diferencial;Experiência prévia no mercado jurídico será considerado um diferencial.Additional informationContratação via PJ;VR (R$28,50/por dia);Plano de Saúde;Auxílio Creche;Auxílio Home Office;Day Off | folga para comemorar o seu aniversário;13º salário;30 dias de pausa remunerada;Programa Auxílio Educação;Empresa em momento de aceleração, o que propicia crescimentos conjuntos;Empresa operando em Home Office, temos pessoas em vários estados (e países).Somos a Doc9 LawtechDesde o início, entendemos como cada detalhe, cada ação e cada erro se interconectam em nossa jornada. Todo aprendizado se torna um documento que guia nossos próximos passos. É este ciclo que sustenta nosso futuro. Enxergamos as conexões em cada pequeno aspecto do que fazemos e buscamos tornar a vida mais leve e as rotinas jurídicas mais simples e eficazes.A DOC9 surgiu para transformar os departamentos e escritórios jurídicos, tornando-os mais ágeis e reduzindo seus custos. Com o tempo, percebemos que poderíamos ir além: inovamos e expandimos nosso portfólio para gestão de acessos, certificados digitais e documentos em diversos segmentos. Reinventamos as relações jurídicas, com menos juridiquês e mais realidade. Porque acreditamos que se a vida é feita de relações jurídicas, elas devem ser leves e positivas.Nossos Valores Refletem Nossa MissãoFacilitar Rotinas Jurídicas: Simplificar é nossa vocação.Relações Interpessoais: Valorizamos a conexão genuína entre pessoas.Eficiência e Segurança: Entregar soluções inovadoras sem comprometer a confiabilidade.Vida: Inspirar leveza e positividade em cada interação.Se você busca uma empresa que vê além do juridiquês, que entende a vida como um conjunto de relações interconectadas e que trabalha para torná-las mais leves, venha fazer parte da nossa história. Estamos ansiosos para conhecer o brilho em seus olhos!Descubra mais sobre nossa missão e visão visitando nossos canais de comunicação.Site: doc9.com.brLinkedIn: doc9lawtechInstagram: doc9.oficial

title: Contract UX Designer
description: Interested in Contract UX Design opportunities at Blue State? Submit an application so you can be considered when a role becomes available. Please note that this is not an active job post.What To KnowOffer innovative and intuitive experience design thinking to a diverse set of clients, from small nonprofits and political campaigns to fortune 500 companies. Blue State, a creative strategy and tech agency, seeks a remote freelance UX designer and strategist. Applicants should have experience in user research and designing innovative, elegant experiences that meet user needs and drive measurable results for organizations. We're looking for creative thinkers who are excited by the opportunity to solve complex problems for clients and who can present solutions clearly and articulately. Experience with content strategy, web development, data visualization, visual design, usability testing, content creation, SEO, web analytics, or social media is a plus.The CompanyBlue State is a purpose-driven agency. We partner with leading causes, brands, and campaigns and create real change. From Google and UNICEF to Amnesty International and Oxfam, we transform how brands and causes raise money, influence policy, build platforms, and grow communities of supporters. Led by the most creative and analytical minds from the political, nonprofit, and brand worlds, Blue State is a part of WPP Digital and has 150+ employees in the US and London.The teamYou'll be part of a team of UX designers where each member is a huge contributor to the projects they lead. We value a strong aesthetic point of view, a desire to experiment with new trends and technologies, a willingness to push the boundaries of UX, and a good sense of humor. We offer a culture that will support and encourage your ambitions to build on your UX expertise and take creative chances.A day in the lifeLead the strategy, information architecture and user experience design for websites, from kickoff to user research and through the development of sitemap, wireframes and/or prototypes. Participate in collaborative workshops and co-design activities to iterate with clients and users, quickly arriving at design solutionsLead discovery activities, including competitive analysis, content and site audits, and qualitative and quantitative user research. Structure and execute user-centered research, including user interviews, usability testing, survey creation and analyses, card sorting and tree testing. Synthesize and present research findings through user personas, user journeys, experience maps, and feature requirements documentationCreate innovative and intuitive design frameworks articulated through wireframes, sitemaps, and clickable prototypes. Work closely with visual designers, strategists, product managers, and developers throughout the design process, from concept to launch. Some things we're looking forWe're looking for strategic thinkers who are excited by opportunities to solve complex problems for clients and who can present solutions clearly and articulately.Qualifications:3+ years prior work experience in a related roleA portfolio exhibiting your UX strategy and design skillsExceptional verbal, written, and presentation skillsAbility to express abstract concepts in concrete waysMethodical, problem-solving mindset and attention to detailSelf-starting and flexible; with an ability to work independentlyThe ability to juggle multiple projects in a fast-paced, demanding environmentComfort with ambiguity and a commitment to constant iteration and improvementThe salary range for this position is $85-$110 per hour; compensation will be commensurate with experience.At Blue State, diversity is a necessity, not a nice-to-have. We encourage those from underrepresented communities — women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, immigrants, those with disabilities and people at all the intersections in between — to apply. Even if you don't think your current skill set checks every box below, but this role seems to align with your strengths, we want to hear from you.Blue State is committed to creating an inclusive and accessible application and interview process. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation for a disability, please contact us at recruiting@bluestate.co with the subject line: Accommodation Request to get started.If an opportunity becomes available and we determine that you are qualified, we will reach out.Your privacy is important to us. You can find out more information on how we handle your data for recruiting purposes in our Privacy Policy for Recruitment.

title: UIX UX Designer
description: About The Job UIX UX DesignerGentis Solutions is seeking an UIX UX Designer to join our team. This contract position is with one of our Fortune 50 clients interested in full-time flex/remote consultants. The ideal candidates will have the required skills listed below and will be eligible and open to being hired by our client at the end of the project's duration. This position works alongside an existing team and leverages enterprise-level technologies and processes. If you would like to work at a company that has been recognized for its diversity and inclusion, its work to drive positive social change, and as an environmental leader, make sure you apply below.RequirementsProficient in product design methodologies and workflows, including ideation, prototyping, and iteration processesStrong expertise in both user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design, with a focus on creating intuitive and visually appealing digital experiencesExperience collaborating with developers to ensure seamless implementation of design solutions and an understanding of technical constraintsAbility to effectively visualize complex data sets and information through compelling and user-friendly data visualizationsFamiliarity with B2B end users and the unique challenges and considerations involved in designing for business-to-business contexts, in addition to B2CProficient in conducting user research, including qualitative and quantitative methods, to gain deep insights into user needs, behaviors, and preferencesStrong knowledge and application of user-centered design methods, ensuring that design decisions are driven by user needs and goalsDemonstrated ability to measure the effectiveness and impact of design solutions through appropriate metrics and analytics toolsMeticulous attention to detail, with a focus on delivering high-quality designs that are pixel-perfect and align with design specificationsExperience with data analytics, utilizing tools and techniques to analyze user behavior, identify patterns, and make data-informed design decisionsProficiency in working with design systems and creating or contributing to the development of a cohesive design language and component libraryStrategic mindset with the ability to align design decisions with broader business objectives and goalsTypical DutiesConduct competitive analyses of other websites that operate in the same spacePrepare customer analyses based on our target demographic and initial transactionsParticipate in creating a content development strategyLeverage existing design systems to standardize new experiencesPartner with development teams to bring ideas to lifeCoordinate with UI design team on issues like navigation, page routing, product page design and moreTrack usability goals and prepare reports for senior managementDevelop mockups for our development and design teamConduct usability tests on each independent type of page on the website and create a report showcasing your findingsPartner with digital stakeholders and consumer insight to develop the customer experience strategy and vision while communicating to company officers and senior managementProvide leadership direction to direct and matrixed core team members, incorporating feedback from across all functions within the Digital Customer Program#

title: UX Designer
description: Opportunity DescriptionThis role will review and understand current cardiovascular medicine education offerings, suggest data-driven enhancements for new and existing offerings, and help identify areas of opportunity and growth.Skills & Qualifications: 2+ years of experience as an information architect, product designer, user experience designer, interaction designer or similar role An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating your process for creating great user-centered design solutions Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders and drive alignment across multiple organizations Able to assert a point of view positively Ability to work efficiently and demonstrate a bias for action in a fast-paced environment, working on ambiguous and challenging projects Experience working in collaboration with developers for implementation of customer experiences Experience documenting and communicating complex experiences with attention to detail to justify UX decisions and rationale Experience with best practices for information architecture and design, as well as experience with usability principles and techniques Proficiency in a variety of design tools such as Sketch, InVision, Axure, Principle, Framer, Flinto, Illustrator, Adobe XD Preferred: Experience with Agile processes and partnering with technical product management and developers for design implementation Understanding of HTML/CSS (position does not include front-end development) Experience developing and maintaining pattern libraries/design systems Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills including the ability to communicate interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively Experience in user research Experience designing for the healthcare industry Touch and mobile first experience.RequirementsResponsibilitiesSpecific deliverables for this role will include: Advocating for users' needs and collaborating with the Product Manager to develop features that align to those needs Creating sketches, wireframes, journey maps, storyboards, user flows and other design artifacts to effectively communicate interaction, application design concepts and details Working with a cross functional team using Agile methodology to define user stories and necessary UX deliverables as part of sprint planning with the scrum project team to which you are assigned Preparing UX documentation (navigation flows, wire frames, mock-ups, use cases, task flows, prototypes, etc.) to be used by the development team Creating the user experience and information architecture for digital experiences; define functionality, navigation, and interaction models through page level wireframes, site-maps, use cases, and functional requirements in an agile environment Creating prototypes (low- and high-fidelity) to communicate micro interactions Documenting and communicating complex, data-driven experiences with attention to detail Producing design deliverables such as sketches, scenarios, wireframes, mental models and prototypes Leading and facilitating brainstorming and sketching sessions with product teams Collaborating with other UX team members and stakeholders to understand and design based on user and business needs as well as technical considerations Establishing and promoting design guidelines, best practices and standards. Working closely with development teams Planning and designing responsive and mobile web applications Providing and receiving UX feedback to/from peers Participating in user research, concept testing, usability testing and analytics to understand target audiences' needs, tasks and goals Applying customer feedback to UX deliverables throughout the project lifecycle.

title: Entry level Graphic and UI/UX Designer
Product Designer (UI/UX)
description: Who We AreAs seen on TechCrunch, Forbes, and Bloomberg, join one of the fastest growing areas in FinTech by taking on the credit system.Work directly with one of Inc.’s top female founders and learn from some of the most talented people in the industry. Headquartered in San Francisco, Tomo’s mission is to replace the outdated credit system and open access to banking.We value passionate, down to earth, “can do” people who enjoy fine-tuning small details, without losing sight of the big picture. We are looking for someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution. You are a self-starter with a high degree of rigor, organization, and discipline to get things done. Above all else, this role requires someone who takes great pride in their work and is inspired and motivated by their role in improving the way millions of people build their financial future.The RoleTomocredit is looking for a UX Designer to build user-facing UI for multiple frontend apps at Tomocredit. As a UX Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. You’ll work closely with engineering, product, and management teams to execute on our vision to create a financial system that is open and accessible to everyone.What You'll Be DoingConsult with product and management teams to convert ideas to the user experience / frontend appDesign UI for web-based frontend appsDesign UI for the Tomo mobile app (currently React Native - both iOS & Android)Define detailed styling, such as color and pixel valuesConduct usability testingCreate wireframes, storyboards, sitemaps and screen flowsCreate product prototypesDevelop personas and usage scenariosAnalyze user feedback and activity, and iterate to enhance the user experienceAssist with content developmentConduct competitor and customer analysisWhat You'll NeedBachelor's degree in Design or equivalent practical experience.Experience working with a team of engineers and product managers throughout the design process creating user flows, wireframes, building user interface mockups, and prototypes.Experience designing consumer-facing experiences - must have worked on a consumer product before.5+ years experience designing frontend/mobile apps in Figma or equivalentPreferred QualificationsExperience working on fintech productsExperience with coding and ability to troubleshoot using HTML, CSS and comparable languagesWhy Tomocredit?Make a huge impact on the future of credit. Be mentored by some of the most seasoned FinTech executives from Square, Lending Club, and American Express, or build your own path. We want people to build their career here because they love the people they work with. Help contribute and build a strong culture because that’s what we care about. That’s why we have generous benefits: Salary, Equity, Insurance, Flexible Vacation Policy and Company-sponsored outings are just a few great things Tomo has to offer. We’re also pet friendly!Competitive SalaryInsurance: Medical, Dental and Vision benefits.Equity: We're growing rapidly, and we want to share our future success/ financial upside with you. We offer an above-average ownership stake in Tomocredit for all employees.Flexible vacation policy. We trust that you know how to manage your time wisely so you can finish your work on time without burnout. Within that trust, we offer a flexible vacation policy.Company-sponsored outings. This is the best outlet to get to know each other outside work.Pet-friendly office! Feel free to bring your furry friend to the office anytime:)At Tomo diversity is important to us so all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: UX Designer
description: Join our dynamic and innovative team at Payzer, where UX Designers are instrumental in shaping the future of our digital products. We're dedicated to creating exceptional user experiences that leave a lasting impact on our customers. If you're passionate about enhancing user functionality and usability while collaborating with cross-functional teams, this opportunity is perfect for you.Key Functions:Create wireframes and screen flows that prioritize a user-centered approach, ensuring a seamless and intuitive user experienceAnalyze user feedback and activity data to iteratively enhance the user experience, incorporating valuable insights into product improvementsCollaborate closely with Product Managers and other stakeholders to thoroughly understand client goals and design innovative solutions that align with strategic objectivesPlan and conduct usability testing to gather user insights and validate design choices, ensuring optimal usability and accessibilityConduct competitor and customer analysis to stay informed about market trends and best practices, informing design decisionsLead and actively participate in design review sessions with stakeholders to gather input, provide design rationale, and ensure alignment with project goalsDocument comprehensive business requirements within design workflows to facilitate a clear understanding of new functionality among cross-functional teamsCreate and maintain up-to-date product mockups, ensuring design consistency and accuracy throughout the development processProvide guidance and support to ensure adherence to consistency and UX standards within the product, promoting a cohesive user experienceReview new features to ensure they meet established design standards and align with the overall product visionDevelop interactive product prototypes to visualize and communicate design concepts effectivelyAssist with content development efforts and occasional marketing projects, contributing to a cohesive brand identityRequirementsLocated in Charlotte, North Carolina (hybrid work weeks at home and in office)Bachelor’s Degree or higherTech savvy with strong creative and analytical skillsStrong written and oral communicationDetail oriented, creative and curiousResults driven, strong team playerAbility to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyAble to excel in a fast-paced, constantly changing environmentFlexible and adaptable to new or differing responsibilitiesFigma experience requiredJIRA experience preferredBenefitsHybrid work schedule - 2 days inoffice / 3 days at home100% company paid medical/dental/vision insurance for employee and dependentsGenerous PTO & Sick time

title: UI / UX Design Catalog Content Contributor - Part Time
description: We are NYC based, but remote friendly unless specified. Hello, World! Codecademy is on a mission to build inspiring careers in technology through engaging, accessible, and interactive online coding education.Our learners have gone on to start new jobs, launch new companies, and lead new lives thanks to their work with Codecademy, and our platform has transformed the way businesses develop and retain their teams.Since 2011, our team has grown to over 200 employees serving 50+ million learners from 190+ countries. We’ve raised over $82M in venture capital funding from top investors including Prosus, Owl Ventures, Union Square Ventures, Y Combinator, and more--which gives us the capital to get stuff done in an impactful way.Join us to help build a business that empowers tens of millions of people to lead better lives!Overview:Codecademy is looking for a knowledgeable designer or instructor to help write our newest career path, UI and UX Designer. The Catalog Content Contributor works directly with the Codecademy Curriculum team to author interactive lessons, quizzes, projects, and other content items to help turn a high-level syllabus into reality. This is a paid, remote, part-time position, with a typical commitment of 15-25 hours per week.Opportunity Highlights: Design and author interactive lessons, quizzes, articles, tutorials, projects, and other content items as applicable Think pedagogically to break down technical concepts into digestible exercises Collaborate with Codecademy's Curriculum team to craft learning outcomes and build a compelling learner experience. Skills & Qualifications: Fluency with and experience in UI and/or UX Design Formal or informal teaching experience with UI and/or UX Design Experience in Figma A strong command of written and spoken English Bonus Qualifications: Professional experience in UI and/or UX Design Experience in user research methodologies and tools Experience using the Codecademy platform Experience writing educational content that reaches a wide audience in a digital format Target hourly rate for this job requisition is anticipated to be $50 hourly. Codecademy has helped over 45 million people learn to code. Join one of the most exciting technology companies in New York as we change the way people learn and advance their careers. Equal Employment Opportunity At Codecademy, we are committed to teaching people the skills they need to upgrade their careers. Codecademy aims to educate a richly diverse demographic of learners with our product and in order to accomplish this, we believe our team should reflect that rich diversity. Our company celebrates diversity in all of its forms-- race, gender, color, national origin, marital status, sexuality, religion, veteran status, age, ability, disability status-- and works to create an inclusive workplace where people of all backgrounds and beliefs are empowered to better their futures.

title: UX & Product Design Internships (Summer 2024 - NYC, LA or Remote)
Designer
description: Who is Prosek?We are entrepreneurial. Prosek is one of the largest independent communications and marketing firms in the UK and U.S., with offices and strategic partners across the country and worldwide. Prosek provides unparalleled expertise with financial and professional services companies. We are people-centric. Our teams work together in a collegial atmosphere that breeds professional respect and friendship. We are award-winning. Join an "Army of Entrepreneurs" that was recently named 2021 Corporate/Financial Agency of the Year by PRovoke Media..Overview:Prosek Partners is seeking a talented, versatile and motivated full-time designer to join our growing creative services team.The position will be primarily responsible for creating and developing original concepts for websites, brand visual identity systems and marketing collateral. Along with these tasks, the professional we seek will also lead and/or be a key participant in the creation of strategies for both our clients and internal stakeholders, and work on a variety of other projects collaborating with team members throughout our offices in New York, Connecticut, Boston, Washington D.C., Los Angeles, Palm Beach, London, and South Africa.What you'll be doing:Translate ideas, end-user needs, design criteria, and technical features into quality designsSpeak not just passionately about your work but also plainly to those who are inexperiencedExercise a strong grasp of storytelling through layout and information designIf applicable, mentoring junior designers who will support the projects you leadUtilizing best-in-class tools and technologies to realize clients' visionsManage project timelines, key stakeholders, and time management effectively What makes you qualified: 2-5 years of professional design-related experience. Bachelor's degree in design or related fieldAble to design across a range of media including digital, mobile-first and print - bonus points going to those candidates who can demonstrate experience with motion design and/or codingPossess excellent written and verbal communication skillsBe comfortable with receiving, understanding, and giving feedbackCritically analyze and execute on a supplied creative direction Be flexible and passionate about collaborating with other designers Able to work under tight deadlinesBe self-motivated, detail-oriented and confidentCapable of analyzing challenges and create on-brand design solutions that meet measurable business goals and requirementsProficient within Figma and Adobe Creative Cloud tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesignExperience prototyping and creating design systems, component libraries, and visual identity guides within Figma a plus Excellent typography and iconography knowledge-base and skill(s). Ability to create work inspired by ideas and innovative concepts, not trends Knowledge and experience working with CMS platforms such as WordPressWhat are the perks?401(k) employer match: There is no time like the present to prepare for your future!Premium healthcare plans, including medical, dental and vision coverage: Your health comes first. Hybrid work model: 2 days in the office, 3 days from home - Pick your own schedule. 2 weeks of remote work per year: You do you!Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) package including birthday PTO and 6 "It's Ok" days: Enjoy life's moments. Custom career opportunities - Choose your own adventure!Our Core Values:Chemistry, Collaboration and Belonging: Our collegial culture inspires people with different perspectives and backgrounds to work towards common goals as we brainstorm, plan and execute on behalf of our clients and to build our business together. Grit and Hustle: We work hard. We roll up our sleeves. We are not precious or pretentious. We do not take short cuts. Instead, we put in the work and do what it takes to get the job done. The Excitement of New Challenges: We view challenges as opportunities and embrace them. They motivate us to learn and grow so that we can be the best versions of ourselves, for our clients and each other. A Workplace with Humanity: We recognize the rigor and demand of our work. We also recognize that life inside and outside of Prosek can be stressful. We work very hard to run our business with a heavy dose of humanity and to make Prosek a safe place where people enjoy the work and each other. Our Beliefs on Culture, Diversity & Belonging:We are committed to building a diverse workforce reflecting and embracing diversity of all kinds - race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, political affiliation, socioeconomic backgrounds. We believe having teams that represent the broader communities where we live and work creates a culture that celebrates creativity, inclusiveness and teamwork and helps us offer our global clientele of mature and emerging businesses counsel that is dynamic, rich and nuanced.The anticipated salary range for this position is $65,000-$90,000. An employee's salary is determined by a range of factors including but not limited to relevant experience, qualifications, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, and business or organizational needs. The range listed is one component of Prosek's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include medical, dental and vision coverage, 401(k) matching, new business commission, paid time off, and other benefits.Prosek Partners provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: UX Designer
description: Job Title - UX DesignerLocation - Alpharetta, GA (Onsite from Day 1)Phone + SkypeVisa - GC, USC, EAD Job DescriptionThe UX designer must be an experienced designer, advocate for the customer. The design manager expects the implementation of UX artifacts at all times, to solve problems focused not only on the business, but also on the end user. Success in this role is dependent on being self-managed, efficiently organized, open to feedback and collaborative. The UX manager always expects attention to detail, proactivity implementing UX artifacts without being prompted (like personas, empathy maps, user flows) lead meetings with product owners and product managers always advocating about the end user, documentation of UX processes, research methodologies (research plan, user research, competitor research and market research are some examples)You'll Get The Chance ToCollaborate with stakeholders, engineering product managers, enterprise architects, software engineers, and other experience designers to understand the goals and requirements necessary to meet business objectives.Establish and communicate design vision, principles and ideas via concept sketches, storyboards, lo/hi fidelity wireframes and prototypes.Drive the product experience vision: from proof-of-concepts to live, tangible products in partnership with multidisciplinary teams.Serve as part of the leadership team steering end-to-end digital transformation projects.Identify insights from customer research and bring them to life through personas, customer journeys, insight-opportunity, frameworks, system maps, workflows, and use-case scenarios.What Will Help You Succeed5-8 years of experience as an UX DesignerFinancial experienceExperience with a wide range of wireframing, visual design, and prototyping tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, InVision, Axure, et al.). Ability to work on experience flows as well as concepts for visual designs.Proficiency in Figma tools (design systems knowledge) is a mustAbility to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.A solid UX design process focused on outcomes.Experience with user research, user-centered design techniques, design systems, visual design principles, and interaction design concepts.Experience designing software within an Agile SDLC.Experience in UX design standard methodologies to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.Ability to collaborate and communicate closely with teams and other partners in a distributed model.Strong intuition and a natural ability to empathize with different people.Outstanding communication skills with the ability to persuade others of your good ideas.Experience designing large-scale systemsWritten skills, communication skills and influencing skills are a must.Strong capacity for leading junior designers, dealing with ambiguity and lack of requirements.Gaurav NainIT Technical RecruiterPhone : 732-795-6262Email: Gaurav@stellentit.comGtalk: gaurav@stellentit.com

title: UI/UX Designer
description: Remote, candidate need to go to the office only once or twice during the project.The selected candidate will serve as a UI/UX Designer for internal and externally facing applications which include mobile applications.As our lead designer, you'll work closely with our product owners, Enterprise Architects, and Tech Leads to set the vision for our overall user experience and ensure adherence to the Delivery Center's UI/UX Design Standards. You'll have the opportunity to interact with customers to understand their pain points and uncover unmet needs. You'll inspire what's possible by quickly producing multiple concepts, knowing when to apply attention to detail, and when to make low-fi sketches and prototypes. You'll also partner closely with our technical team to find practical solutions to design challenges.In addition, the selected candidate will also serve as our Delivery Center's Digital Accessibility SME. You'll gain an understanding of the Commonwealth's digital accessibility goals, testing tools, and methodologies and work to implement them across the Delivery Center.Core Responsibilities" Develop the overall user experience through collaboration with key users to understand Product Vision, Roadmap and User Stories." Act as the lead designer on all product work. Create storyboards, wireframes, mockups, user flows, prototypes, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design concepts." Create production-ready art assets and style guides for implementation by the development team." Work closely with our Development Team to support requirements, and ability to design complex user interfaces." Assist in collecting user feedback and usability testing to understand users' needs and refine design concepts." Ability to think long-term and short-term to meet the constraints of a continuous release process while iterating toward a future vision." User-focused design mentality and constantly looking to sharpen your instincts through user feedback and insight." Assist with writing user stories based on user requirements and test completed user stories against acceptance criteria." Understand and implement Digital Accessibility tools and standards.Requirements" Provide a portfolio in Adobe XD or similar format and demonstrate the ability to design complex user interfaces" Experience in working on a Scrum Team or similar Agile Development Team." A strong understanding of web and mobile UI standards, usability, and practical experience in the design and development of user interfaces for web and mobile applications." Familiarity with digital accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1)." Expert user of prototyping and wireframing using tools like Sketch, Adobe XD, or similar tools." Ability to use Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator if needed." Ability to conduct user research like card sorting, journey maps and others." Ability to think at a high level about product strategy and vision but also have a sharp eye for detail." Experience with creating clear web and digital experiences." Understanding of the User Experience (UX) Design process or methodology." Strong communication skills and the ability to present and sell ideas to various audiences (technical and non-technical).
