for Lyft’s customersCo-lead with talented, empathetic cross-functional partners on research, product strategy, process and executionOwn cross-functional and cross-team efforts to build high value opportunities that uphold Lyft’s standards and values across our experiencesResponsibilities:Problem solve, think big, and explore divergent concepts/ideas while understanding how to converge and build iteratively towards your vision.Plan strategically and think tactically as a partner with product and engineering to define priorities and products.Influence the shape of the product with research and data while executing design work using high quality wireframes, mockups, user journeys, and cross-platform interactive prototypes.Advocate for design by sharing your work and presenting cross-functionally, while effectively articulating design rationale.Inspire the entire team (including cross-functional partners) by bringing new ideas to the table.Create a unified, end-to-end experience through close collaboration with Media team members.Experience:8+ years of experience working in Product Design, UX, UI, or an HCI related field with experience working on web and mobile design at high-growth technology companies with a focus on advertisingExperience working on retail media / commerce media ad networks and productsExperience working with a lean team of Researchers, Engineers, Product Managers, Sales, Marketing and Program ManagersExperience designing innovative productsExcellent oral and written communication skillsFamiliarity with user research methods and analysisExpertise with Figma and other design and prototyping toolsExcellence in design craftAbility to work with a low-ego, highly collaborative, cross-functional teamExcited and comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-changing environmentEven if you don't directly have all of the skills above, please consider applying. We know talent takes many different shapes.Benefits:Great medical, dental, and vision insurance optionsIn addition to 11 observed holidays, salaried team members have unlimited paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off401(k) plan to help save for your future18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligiblePre-tax commuter benefitsLyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership ProgramLyft is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Starting in September 2023, this role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Thursdays and a team-specific third day. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year.The expected base pay range for this position in the New York is $193,500 - 215,000. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Range is not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.

title: UX Researcher
description: DescriptionPosition at Glidewell DentalEssential FunctionsParticipates in all project phases, from strategy to launch.Supports cross-functional product teams and the organization to achieve solutions that are right for our customers and adhere to the product vision.Delivers compelling research findings and insights to immediate project team and management level.Please check L (Still Learning Function), P (Successfully Performing), NP (Not Performing) or N/A (Not Applicable) for each as appropriate. Note comment # on page 2c.Identifies user requirements through research and analysis of user needs, preferences, objectives, and work methods.Collaborates with teams to plan usability testing sessions; identifies participants for usability testing. Informs design decisions through utilization of user insight, analytics, best practice, and competitor analysis. Handles multiple projects in parallel and executes work efforts in an agile and efficient manner in support of business plans.Acts as a technical resource for internal team members.Performs other related duties and projects as business needs require at direction of management.Education And ExperienceBachelor’s degree in the field of Psychology, Anthropology, Cognitive Science, Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Interaction Design, or similar; Master’s Degree preferred.Experience in a UX-related role, or any equivalent education and/or experience from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been demonstrated/achieved.Experience with research, analytics, and design tools such as Lookback, UserTesting, Optimal Workshop, Hotjar, Dovetail, Google Analytics, Amplitude, Segment, and Figma.Pay Range: 80,000.00/YR to 150,000.00/YR (Depending on experience)Location: Hybrid in Irvine, CAGlidewell Laboratories is the industry leader in dental technology due to our agility, speed, and cutting edge technology. We work in a fast-paced and highly sought-after employee-friendly work environment. Behind all of this success is an amazing group of people who are passionate about bringing innovation to the marketplace, while providing quality and affordability to better the lives of people all over the world. If you share in our passion for teamwork and a vision for excellence, let's talk about a rewarding career at Glidewell!In addition are the following generous employee benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with company match, company-paid life insurance, additional onsite dental services, vacation, holiday, and sick time, employee gym (with fitness classes and meditation room), employee medical/wellness center (with massage therapy and acupuncture), two company subsidized cafes, Internet cafes, employee lounges with big screen TVs, game tables, fun company sponsored events, a diverse work environment with over forty nationalities represented, and much more! Note to Current employees: Please apply through Employee Transfer Application to complete the transfer request form.

title: UI/UX Designer
description: Northwest Partners is seeking a UX Designer experienced in accessibility design to join a dynamic web accessibility assessment and remediation initiatives.**Candidates must be legally authorized to work for any employer in the United States without sponsorship**What YOU will do as a successful UX DesignerFacilitate comprehensive user research through interviews, surveys, and workshops to gather insights on user interaction with our products.Develop and refine user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to foster intuitive user experiences.Innovate and design wireframes, user narratives, pathways, and mockups, ensuring optimal functionality across diverse devices and interfaces.Strategically enhance user experience by making informed decisions about core functionalities and emerging features.Work collaboratively with colleagues and stakeholders to advance project goals.Champion the client's vision by crafting, testing, and refining digital experiences.Execute user interface testing, including calls-to-action, banners, layout configurations, design aesthetics, navigational flows, and landing page link targets.Utilize data and analytics to refine user experiences and communicate performance metrics.Ensure UX design compliant with ADA accessibility guidelines.Minimum Qualification For ConsiderationAt least 5 years of related professional experience using standard UX tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Suite, XD, Axure, UXPin, InVision.Experience in designing responsive consumer-facing applications.Professional certification in UI accessibility design is a plus.A minimum of 3 years of experience in phased UX modernization of products.Practical knowledge of HTML5 and CSS.Proficiency in generating interaction design materials like concept diagrams, wireframes, and prototypes (both low and high fidelity).Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.A bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.About Northwest PartnersNorthwest Partners is dedicated to moving at the speed of innovation. We work with clients across the globe to provide exceptional knowledge, talent, and resources. As a trusted partner, we merge the client's vision with our expertise to deliver powerful results. Northwest Partners is known for building and managing elite teams in technology across diverse industries. Our mission is to empower every talent and every client to achieve more.

title: Staff Product Designer - Pandora Ads Experience
description: Who We AreSiriusXM and its brands (Pandora, SXM Media, AdsWizz, Simplecast, and SiriusXM Connected Vehicle Services) are leading a new era of audio entertainment and services by delivering the most compelling subscription and ad-supported audio entertainment experience for listeners -- in the car, at home, and anywhere on the go with connected devices. Our vision is to shape the future of audio, where everyone can be effortlessly connected to the voices, stories and music they love wherever they are.This is the place where a diverse group of emerging talent and legends alike come to share authentic and purposeful songs, stories, sounds and insights through some of the best programming and technology in the world. Our critically-acclaimed, industry-leading audio entertainment encompasses music, sports, comedy, news, talk, live events, and podcasting. No matter their individual role, each of our employees plays a vital part in bringing SiriusXM’s vision to life every day.Pandora, a subsidiary of SiriusXM, is the largest ad-supported audio entertainment streaming service in the U.S. Pandora provides consumers with a uniquely-personalized music and podcast listening experience with its proprietary Music Genome Project® and Podcast Genome Project® technology. Pandora is available through its mobile app, the web, and integrations with more than 2,000 connected products.How You’ll Make An ImpactAs a Pandora Listener Experience designer, you will collaborate with an inspiring team of designers and cross-functional partners to craft the immersive, uniquely-Pandora in-app audio experience loved by tens of millions of passionate listeners. You will be challenged to innovate and differentiate our services within the competitive streaming market, address our listeners’ wide range of “audio jobs to be done”, and impact SiriusXM + Pandora’s core business metrics. With a focus on our listener-facing advertising experiences, you will live at the intersection of monetization and building the best musical experience for our listeners.What You’ll DoDevelop a nuanced understanding of Pandora’s business goals as well as the needs and perspectives of our listeners and advertisersTranslate those goals and needs into a creative vision, hypotheses, and experiments – realized by elegant, actionable, and effective design solutions via sketches, wireframes, user flows, prototypes, visual mocks, and interaction specsLead the design and integration of our listener-facing ads experiences including audio ads, display ads, rewarded ads, and sponsorshipsConsider the full ecosystem of our listener experience across mobile, web, TV, and other devices as well as connect to the tools & teams powering the front-end experienceCollaborate with org-wide cross-functional partners to define, build a shared understanding around, implement, and measure the impact of our designsBe a great design team member – we make each other better designers by providing and being receptive to feedback, asking the right questions, and recognizing we each bring unique and valuable perspectives to the teamShape the product design process – we constantly reflect upon the way we work and rely on our designers to help us iterate and improveEvangelize user-centered design across the companyNote that this role does not have any official supervisory responsibilities but there are always opportunities to mentor other designers if that is of interest to you. Our team supports growth paths that lead toward management positions or continued individual contributor work and we recognize the importance of both.What You’ll NeedNote that aside from the legal right to work these are not hard requirements and you don’t need to meet 100% of them to be considered. We specifically do not require a degree because we know that good designers can come from anywhere with the right amount of drive and experience. If you think you would be a good fit, we’d love to see your application. 5+ years of experience in product design and development, preferably leading ad-supported media experiences – demonstrable via design portfolio, use cases, in-market products, etc. Portfolios should highlight challenges you faced, how you collaborated with others, what you learned, and the personal/business/end-user impact of your work.Bachelor of Science in a design or tech-related field or equivalent industry experienceA user-centered approach to problem solving that leverages research, analytics, and empathy combined with strong design intuition and best practicesAn understanding of today’s common design patterns (across mobile, web, desktop) and an awareness of when it’s appropriate (or not) to deviate from themDemonstrated commitment to growth and learning professionally and personallyExcellent communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to tailor communications to your audienceHabit of sharing your work at all stages to leverage the expertise of those around youPatience, kindness, accountability, and curiosityMust have legal right to work in the U.S.Technical RequirementsExpert-level skills with current UX/Service Design tools (we use Figma but we can ramp you up if you currently use another)Familiarity with project management tools (we use Jira)Fluency with presentation software such as Google Slides or PowerpointAlthough no coding is required for this role, you must have a solid understanding of general development processes, technologies, and frameworks (i.e. presentation layer coding, iOS, Android, etc.)Familiarity with component-based Design Systems Our goal at SiriusXM is to provide and maintain a work environment that fosters mutual respect, professionalism and cooperation.At SiriusXM, we carefully consider a wide range of factors when determining compensation, including your background and experience. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary. We expect the base salary for this position to be in the range of $132,500 to $200,000 and will depend on your skills, qualifications, and experience. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary short-term and long-term incentives. We encourage all interested candidates to apply.SiriusXM is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, gender identity, marital status, familial status, veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.The requirements and duties described above may be modified or waived by the Company in its sole discretion without notice.R-2023-10-13

title: UX Researcher, Quantitative
description: Our UX Research team is designing for the global diversity of human needs, which requires us to deeply understand the behaviors of the people behind them. Our researchers tackle some of the most complex challenges to gain deeper insights into how people interact with each other and the world around them, and work collaboratively to contribute new ideas to products that impact the experiences of billions of people on a global scale. This job description represents different full-time roles across Meta.We use a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods to accomplish our goals, including surveys, focus groups, field studies, usability tests, and 1:1 interviews. We value a diverse range of perspectives and stem from many different backgrounds.We’re looking for excellent communicators who are knowledgeable about research devoted to understanding people, and curious about the relationship between technology and society. They will also need to be comfortable in a fast-moving organization, open-minded about learning new research methods, committed to high-quality and rigorous research, and focused on influencing the future of Meta.UX Researcher, Quantitative Responsibilities:Work closely with product and business teams to identify research topicsAct as a thought leader in the domain of research, while advocating for the people who could use our productsDesign and execute end-to-end custom primary research using a wide variety of methodsDesign studies that address both user behavior and attitudesAbility to work independently and autonomouslyEffectively manage and prioritize research plans through ambiguous and fast-changing environments, align and efficiently execute critical insights and work with a large group of stakeholdersCommunicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative waysWork cross-functionally with design, product management, content strategy, engineering and marketingGenerate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designsMinimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree with 10+ years’ of relevant experience in user experience, applied research and/or product research and development or a Master’s degree and 8+ years’ relevant experience, or PhD and 5+ year relevant experienceExperience coding with R, SQL, STATA, SPSS or equivalentExperience with survey design and response effectsExperience applying statistical analysis methods such as Regressions, ANOVA, and T-TestsInterest in and experience executing hands-on, primary researchExperience translating research findings into strategic narrativesPreferred Qualifications:Degrees in a human behavior related field, such as Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, Communication, Information Science, Media Studies, Computer Science, or EconomicsExperience with consumer products, consumer insights, or product developmentAbout Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

title: UI/UX Designer
description: DescriptionPosition at ApexonCompany DescriptionApexon is a digital-first technology services firm backed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management and Everstone Capital. We specialize in accelerating business transformation and delivering human-centric digital experiences. For over 17 years, Apexon has been meeting customers wherever they are in the digital lifecycle and helping them outperform their competition through speed and innovation.Responsibilities Works directly with project team including business analysts, business owners, solution architects, tech leads, developers, and QA to ensure understanding of the requirements, functionality, size, scalability, and usability of the IT solution. Works in conjunction with the Business Analyst to examine existing business processes and systems to develop a full representation of the system’s interface design and usability by the business. Participates in all requirement gathering meetings, Joint Application Modeling (JAM) sessions, and/or brainstorm sessions with business owners to identify product usability concerns and desires. Examine and analyze current user(s) flow and process, pain points, and desires from a usability and visual standpoint to deliver proper solutions. Leads the overall visual design and usability of the product. Provides expertise and leads the project team through applicable design patterns, screen layout decisions, and usability testing. Serves as an advocate for the end user of the product, consistently working to improve the overall design and usability of the delivered product, as the budget allows. Creates sketches, wireframes, and mockups of user interface screens according to the requirements/user stories that adhere to SOM Look & Feel Standards as well as the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) requirements. Creates high-fidelity functioning prototypes when applicable/feasible. Reviews wireframes with the Business Analyst for business requirements and with Technical Lead for technical feasibility before presenting wireframe solutions to the business. Provides guidance to the development team regarding UI/UX best practices, established coding standards, and ADA vulnerability remediation. Ensures conformance to the State of Michigan (SOM) Look & Feel Standards. Performs usability testing to ensure conformance with UI/UX best practices. Performs accessibility testing to ensure conformance to the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) requirements. Creates and facilitates usability tests with the intended users of the product and iterates screen designs accordingly. Actively advises developers on accessibility requirements and vulnerability remediation. Serve as liaison to DTMB Center for Shared Solutions (CSS) eMichigan team.DisclaimerIf you feel that this is a good match for your skillsets, please submit a current word version of your resume along with a cover letter describing your skills, experience and salary expectations. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).

title: Digital Designer
description: About UsDyson is a global technology enterprise. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people. Dyson launched in the US in 2002, and since then operations have grown exponentially. Our US headquarters is based in Chicago's Fulton Market neighborhood. We also have employees working in field sales, our service centers, and in our growing number of Dyson Demo Store’s across the country.Dyson has a regional creative department that brings to life the global approach to communication at the regional level and executes market-driven campaigns. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of our campaign team within the Center of Excellence for the Americas. The content created within the regions is data-driven, user-centric, always-on and relatable to consumers across the Americas – US, Canada and Mexico. Dyson is seeking a digital designer to contribute to the company’s site marketing activities.About The RoleThe position reports into the Americas Creative Director, and requires someone who has exceptional digital design skills for web development as well as social and digital advertising campaigns.You’ll work closely with the site merchandising team, media team, copywriters, and UX designers to design memorable experiences that engage audiences at any point in their journey across our Direct and controlled digital channels.Partner with Product Owners, the COE and UK Creative Teams to support the creative execution of our direct value propositions and enhancements online.Work closely with the UX Designer, Direct (.com) team, and Copywriter to creatively respond to site metrics, re-designing the site elements to test and learn the best approach to ensure a frictionless consumer journeys on owned and 3rd party sites.Bring a fresh perspective to the design digital experiences.Ensure all work is in line with Dyson brand values and follows the relevant brand & design guidelines.Demonstrate creative thinking that takes already established strategies and translates them into dynamic digital creative executions.Work with dedicated digital developers to ensure the execution of final design and interactions into build are understood and pixel perfect across all digital platforms.Confidently present your work with clarity to relevant stakeholders.Stay abreast of the digital landscape – explore ideas of advancements in technology and design, trends in social and connected products etc.Continuous development and honing of the technical abilities relevant to the role.About You:2-4 years’ experience of working as part of a wider team to deliver digital journeys, all of which is demonstrable through an excellent portfolio of past work for leading or interesting brands.Experience designing responsive digital content that works across different devices (mobile, tablets, apps), as well as a good understanding of which platform works best for any given requirement.Experience designing within 3rd party ecosystems such as Amazon.Big picture thinker with an understanding of how digital creative connects to other media channels and forms a joined-up, compelling customer experience.Eye for detail, composition and typography matter as much to you as they would a print designer.Understanding of information architecture, with the ability to demonstrate user interface design skills.Basic programming and development skills are an advantage in informing the work produced and facilitating the transition from design to build.Excited by all things art and design, taking inspiration from a wide range of sources, utilizing found images, mocked-up imagery and film, and mood boards to support thinking and add weight to ideas.Active contributor in group brainstorms who is comfortable expressing ideas, either informally, or in more formal presentations, both to peers and senior stakeholders.A Bachelor of Fine Arts in Design, Bachelor of Design, or Bachelor of Science in Design is desired.Benefits:At Dyson, how we reward you is linked to our high-performance culture. But it’s about more than salary and bonus. Through a package of financial, lifestyle and health benefits, we support whatever stage of life you’re in and the moments that matter.Financial Benefits401K with up to a 4% matchCompany paid Life Insurance and AD&DFlexible Savings Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA)Lifestyle BenefitsCompetitive Paid Time Off Benefits including Separate Holiday, Sick, and Vacation TimePre-tax Commuter Benefits (applicable areas only)Generous Child Care Leave ProgramWellness ProgramEmployee Assistance ProgramGenerous Dyson Product DiscountsHealth BenefitsMulti-Level Healthcare Coverage OptionsVision & Dental CoverageCompany paid Short-Term and Long-Term DisabilityHiring range in New York is between $85,000-105,000 based on experience.This is a hybrid role. Our New York City address is 155 Mercer Street, New York, NY 10012.Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

title: User Experience (UX) Designer
description: Position: User Experience (UX) Designer (MUST be a US Citizen)MUST be a US Citizen Security Requirement: Active Treasury Public Trust Clearance PreferredThis program requires a Minimum Background Investigation (MBI) clearance. Selected candidate shall not start work until authorization and first day logistics are provided by the Program.Location: Remote/ Virtual Continental U.S (Hours: East Coast Time Zone) and Washington, DCDescription/ResponsibilitiesRole responsibilities include:Collaborate with development teams to identify ideas and drive towards solutionsAnalyze the client needs and requirements to provide related insightProactively accomplish User Experience Designer tasks, including but not limited to the creation of wireframesUse human-centered design, Agile, and Pega practices to support elaboration and configuration as a voice advocating for the customerPlan and conduct user interviews for requirements gathering and collaborate with team members on findings and recommendationsSupport testing and future deployments by iteratively reviewing new organization functionalities with user groupsIndependently conduct discussion on Pega design, functionality, and structureLead meetings to discuss and present wireframes, collect client feedback, and iteratively improve designsSupport business process design activities including describing and visualizing business expectations, objectives, user roles, and responsibilities

title: Digital Designer
description: Job Title: Digital DesignerReports to: Creative Design ManagerLocation: Los Angeles, CA (On-site)job Class: Non-ExemptAbout SHEINSHEIN is a global fashion and lifestyle e-retailer committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all. We use on-demand manufacturing technology to connect suppliers to our agile supply chain, reducing inventory waste and enabling us to deliver a variety of affordable products to customers around the world. From our global offices, we reach customers in more than 150 countries. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has nearly 10,000 employees operating from offices around the world, with U.S. Headquarters located in Los Angeles and Global Headquarters located in Singapore. In SHEIN, we work with outstanding, creative, and capable peers. We share an energetic and open culture for capable people to discern, work and ignite as a team. Position SummaryThe Digital Designer will be a member of SHEIN design team, creating our digital marketing assets: email, static and animated paid social ads, landing page and marketing print materials. The right candidate is an expert in graphic design, will have great attention to detail, a good eye for selecting photographic images, strong typography skills, and be methodical in their work.ResponsibilitiesSupport the creative web team to create digital marketing assets: email, homepage, landing page, and print marketing materials.Provide fresh design ideas and execute new web, mobile, app and email experiences under the supervision of the Design manager.Work closely and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including copywriters, marketing, PR, web production, event management, and Global teams.Keep designs up-to-date with design trends, typography, photography, fashion, and social media worlds.Skills and QualificationsBachelor’s degree in graphic design, digital design or Fine arts.Minimum 2+ years of digital design experience within a high-paced, cross-functional creative environment, preferably fashion e-commerce.Must have an online portfolio that shows strong understanding of typography, digital design trends, and online visual communication.Highly creative in typography, web page layout. Experience in UX/UI design is a plus.Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite: Photoshop, Illustrator, Keynote, and InDesign in a Mac environment.Must be able to work as a team member, but also be resourceful as a self-starter. Extremely detail-oriented, flexible and able to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment, managing many projects simultaneously.Pay: $24 - $31 hourlySHEIN Benefits and Culture:Healthcare (medical, dental, vision, prescription drugs)Health Savings Account with Employer FundingFlexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare and Dependent care)Company-Paid Basic Life/AD&D insuranceCompany-Paid Short-Term and Long-Term DisabilityVoluntary Benefit Offerings (Voluntary Life/AD&D, Hospital Indemnity, Critical Illness, and Accident)Employee Assistance ProgramBusiness Travel Accident Insurance401(k) savings plan with discretionary company match and access to a financial advisorVacation, Paid holidays and sick daysEmployee DiscountsPerks (HQ Location):Free weekly catered lunch at HQDog-Friendly officeFree Gym Access at HQFree Swag GiveawaysAnnual Holiday PartyInvitations to pop-ups and other company eventsComplimentary daily office snacks and beveragesFree Shuttle Service from HQ to LA Union StationSHEIN Distribution is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workplace environment.

title: Marketing Designer
description: Intuit Credit Karma is a mission-driven company, focused on championing financial progress for our more than 130 million members globally. While we're best known for pioneering free credit scores, our members turn to us for everything related to their financial goals, including identity monitoring, applying for credit cards, shopping for insurance and loans (car, home and personal) and savings accounts and checking accounts* -- all for free. Credit Karma has grown significantly through the years: we now have more than 1,700 employees across our offices in Oakland, Charlotte, Culver City, San Diego, London and New York City.Banking services provided by MVB Bank, Inc., Member FDICCredit Karma is a mission-driven company, focused on championing financial progress for our more than 120 million+ members. While we're best known for pioneering free credit scores, our members turn to us to help them achieve their financial goals.Reporting into the Creative Director and joining a large team of innovative and collaborative designers, copywriters and motion designers here in Charlotte, NC, the Marketing Designer will work alongside a marketing Copywriter and be responsible for the design work on the Tax vertical. Tax season can be stressful for many millions of Americans. Credit Karma, powered by TurboTax, has features, services and tools that can (and do) make Tax season less taxing. If you are a hardworking, multifaceted and results-driven Designer who wants to connect millions of people to products and features that can improve their financial lives—we’d like to meet you!What You’ll DoLeverage our brand design guidelines in unique ways, while ensuring creative work is on brief, on brand and has an intuitive user experience and visual flowPartner closely with a creative Copywriter and with the wider creative team to cultivate and develop ideasDesign innovative, engaging and hard-working digital marketing for an array of channels including landing pages, emails, in-app surfaces, display networks and more.Ideate on concepts, themes, directions and refine design work based on creative and stakeholder directionIncorporate user experience standard methodologies in all digital marketingComfortably vocalize ideas and process behind each ideaHandle and prioritize multiple projects from concept to completionWhat’s Great About The RoleThe opportunity to collaborate with strategists, performance marketers and product teams throughout the creative process, generate excitement around your design solutions and present creative work to key partnersSee in real time how your design solutions are performing, so you can make informed changes and have an even bigger impact on the communicationsParticipate in team events, broader ideas sessions and department-wide design initiativesUse your yearly professional development stipend to further your knowledge, gain inspiration and add to your creative skillset.Minimum Basic Requirements4+ years experience in design roles at marketing agencies or ‘brand side’A strong portfolio of design work demonstrating conceptual ideas and marketing assets for local, national or international brands (please disclose any passwords to portfolio work when applying)Proficiency in Figma, Illustrator and PhotoshopStrong practice of graphic design principles, showcasing an expert handle on typography, hierarchy, balance, color, composition and systems-level thinkingPreferred QualificationsKeen attention to detail, a strong visual sense and high degree of polish in executionStrong time management skills and ability to prioritize projects and tasksBenefits At Credit Karma IncludesMedical and Dental CoverageRetirement PlanCommuter BenefitsWellness perksPaid Time Off (Vacation, Sick, Baby Bonding, Cultural Observance, & More)Education PerksPaid Gift Week in DecemberPay Transparency Notice: Credit Karma’s mission of championing financial progress for all starts from within. That’s why we implemented role-based compensation, which ensures people who are in the same role receive the same pay with variations for geographic location only. It’s all part of a more comprehensive DEI strategy that helps level the playing field. The base salary range for this role is $101,833 to $117,950, plus equity and benefits.Equal Employment OpportunityCredit Karma is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We welcome all candidates without regard to race, color, religion, age, marital status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, veteran or military status, disability (physical or mental), genetic information or other protected characteristic. We prohibit discrimination of any kind and operate in compliance with applicable fair chance laws.Credit Karma is also committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment because it is the right thing to do. We believe that such an environment advances long-term professional growth, creates a robust business, and supports our mission of championing financial progress for everyone. We offer generous benefits and perks with a single eye to nourishing an inclusive environment that recognizes the contributions of all and fosters diversity by supporting our internal Employee Resource Groups. We’ve worked hard to build an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and the opportunity for professional growth. As part of the Credit Karma team, your voice will be heard, your contributions will matter, and your unique background and experiences will be celebrated.Please contact candidate.support@creditkarma.com if you are interested in employment with Credit Karma and need special assistance or an accommodation to either apply or interview for a specific role.Privacy PoliciesCredit Karma is strongly committed to protecting personal data. Please take a look below to review our privacy policies:GDPR Privacy PolicyU.S. Job Applicant Privacy Notice

title: UX Designer/Product Designer
description: Job Title: UX Designer/Product DesignerLocation: Bothell, WA.Duration: Long TermYou are responsible forWe follow a human-centered design process including analysis, exploration, storytelling, concept design, prototyping, concept and usability testing.The ideal candidate has strong visualization, interaction and prototyping skills in addition to being comfortable working collaboratively within multidisciplinary team.Analysis/research Understanding people, business and societies, framing the problem with a strong focus on user needs and requirementsCreation/validation Creating user focused strategies, innovations, solutions and experiences and the user testing and validation of these, considering usability, sustainability and appropriate visual and verbal articulation in line with DLS and Brand guidelinesProcess/delivery Executing on scope, driving own efficiency, delivering appropriate design quality within budget and project parametersStakeholder focus Focusing on the customer, collaborating, partnering and co-creating with internal and external stakeholders, with clear and impactful communication and articulation of design decision making.Team Contributing to effective teamwork, receiving guidance and being a pro-active team player, offering a point of viewRoles And ResponsibilitiesMaster degree in Design, Design Research or related discipline, or equivalent professionalDesign training experience.Minimum 5+ years of relevant professional experience with apparent leadership potential.Initiates and executes own analysis and research to gain deeper insights as input for solutionExperience with Figma, Sketch and other design / prototyping tools, being flexible in adapting towards new tools and way of working

title: Associate Designer, UX
description: _Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here._****_Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of._****Who We Are…**When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the _storytellers_ bringing our characters to life, the _creators_ bringing them to your living rooms and the _dreamers_ creating what’s next…From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.Warner Bros. Games New York works with some of the top talent in the game industry to build online competitive and social features for video games. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, Warner Bros. Games Montréal, and more!**Your New Role**As an Associate UX/UI Designer at WB Games NY, you will be helping us to design the future of how our consumers interface with our products and services. You will work closely with our engineering and operations teams to understand, and illustrate, the web interfaces to our systems. This position will require research, creativity, technical understanding, and an acute ability to put yourself in the shoes of our end users.WB Games New York works with some of the top talent in the game industry to build online competitive and social features for video games. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, WB Montréal, and more!**Your Role Accountabilities**+ We want you to have a deep understanding of the tools and services that are offered through WB Games New York. While we don’t expect you to write code, we are looking for a level of curiosity from a technical standpoint. We want you to explore and ask plenty of questions.+ You will work directly with our engineers to design user interfaces and dashboards around the complex services that they are delivering.+ We are expecting you to create wireframes, interactive prototypes, and documentation of the frontends that you will be designing.+ From time-to-time, you will work directly with our game teams to help them design custom interfaces around their implementation of our online services.+ You are going to want to be comfortable pitching and presenting new ideas to stakeholders.+ We will be leaning on you to research and understanding the current state of UX/UI design.**Qualifications & Experience**+ Proven experience designing complex user interfaces+ Excellent verbal and communication skills are a must. You will spend a good amount of your time understanding and gathering requirements from many teams across all of WB Games.+ A portfolio of your successes in UI/UX+ Since you are the source of many requirements, not all tasks given to you will have a clearly mapped strategy. We are looking for someone who is comfortable working in an environment like this, who would be eager to help tease and define some of these requirements.+ Ability to excel in a fast paced, startup-like environment**The Nice to Haves**+ While not required, programming experience provides you with more opportunities to take on more complex tasks. This would be a plus for any new candidate.**How We Get Things Done…**This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.**The Legal Bits…**In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $48,994.00 - $90,990.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.#

title: IT User Experience Designer
description: When we build new digital solutions at SAIF, the voice of our customers drives everything we do. The digital experience of our customers — whether looking for information or completing a task — must be intuitive and compelling.We are in the early stages of building out our next generation customer portals, and the user experience designer is a key member of the team leading that effort. Our user experience designer will be a champion of the digital customer experience at SAIF. Your duties will include creating user workflows and prototypes; collaborating on UI and design approaches; planning user experience research; strategizing on customer solutions with the engineering team; managing content development; and planning and synthesizing usability testing. To do this job well, you’ll need experience in user experience, digital design and web-based technologies, and great communication and collaboration skills. Experience in customer journey mapping and user personas are a plus, as are certifications in UX/UI. If you’re ready to shape the digital customer experience at SAIF, apply today. ResponsibilitiesChampions digital user experience design throughout the company and contributes to making it an essential process for improvement and innovation.Organizes usability testing of digital applications. Observes, synthesizes, and provides recommendations to the development teams.Ensures that consistent and intuitive digital user experience is maintained across devices and operating systems.Serves as subject matter expert for and key contributor to Voice of Customer research at the Company, including both qualitative and quantitative research.Serves as a subject matter expert and thought leader on user experience design across the Company.Mentors web designers and authors across the company.Partners with C+D and the IT leadership team to define the omni-channel experience, and to ensure deliverables are consistent with the user experience design vision.Designs current and future omni-channel user experience that meets long term and near-term business goals and user needs.Plan and deliver user experience designs while, working closely with cross-functional teams to create innovative user experiences for new and extended digital experiences.Understand, advocate, apply, and articulate the value of the SAIF brand. Champion the brand’s visual expression in electronic media, mentor others as appropriate.Keep apprised of new developments in web and mobile technology, trends, and best practices.Strong knowledge and understanding of user-centered design.Review competitors’ products for additional insights and keep apprised of new developments in web technology, trends, and best practices.Explore diverse perspectives and consistently behave sensitively toward differences in cultural norms, expectations, and ways of communicating. Work effectively with others who have different perspectives, backgrounds, and/or work styles.Continually sustain the Inclusive Leadership Competencies (ILC) through the Explorer level on an annual basis.The following qualifications are recommended:Five years professional experience demonstrating knowledge and expertise in web-based technologies and the ability to manage web design projects.Three years professional experience designing and analyzing digital user experience projects.A bachelor’s degree in information technology or a related field.Other combinations of skills and experience may be considered.Next stepTo receive consideration, please submit your resume with a cover letter by the close of this recruitment. We want your submission to count, so be sure it’s complete.This recruitment will close on Monday, December 4, 2023. If a sufficient number of qualified applications are received this recruitment may close early.Compensation & BenefitsTypical hiring range:‏‏‎ ‎$105,260‏‏‎ ‎-‏‏‎ ‎$128,651.‏‏‎ ‎The pay range for this position is annually based on a full-time schedule. Actual compensation will be determined using factors such as experience, skills, training, certifications & education. SAIF provides a wide range of benefits to employees who work at least 20 hours per week, including health care, retirement savings plans, paid time off, and more. For additional information about SAIF's total rewards, visit our website at: Total rewards (saif.com)*Note that eligibility and cost of benefits can vary depending on the number of regularly scheduled hours, and job status such as regular full-time, regular part-time, seasonal, or temporary employment.Full salary range:‏‏‎‏‏‎ ‎$87,715‏‏‎ ‎-‏‏‎ ‎$146,195VeteransWe provide preference to qualifying and disabled veterans. For more information please visit saif.com/veterans.About usSince 1914, SAIF has been taking care of injured workers, helping people get back to work, and keeping rates low by focusing on workplace safety. Together with our partners, we strive to make Oregon the safest and healthiest place to work.SAIF is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values diversity in its workplace.

title: UX Designer
description: General information All posting locations Chicago, Illinois, United States of America Job Function 05 - Marketing Date Published 02-Oct-2023 Ref # R-75347 Remote, Hybrid or Onsite HybridRequirements Description & Requirements Who we are We're one of the world's largest food and beverage companies and a trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods, earning us a spot on 97% of American household tables. As the guardians of our beloved brands and the creators of innovative products, we're dedicated To Sustainably Grow by Delighting More Consumers Globally.Today, The Kraft Heinz Company is building a new legacy by investing in a robust Digital infrastructure to revolutionize the food and beverage industry. We are on a journey to create a digitally-powered, agile-enterprise – all while honoring a 150-year heritage and a portfolio of 200 iconic brands. At the heart of this journey is our ambition to create an environment where powerful AI solutions augment humans and where small mission-based teams relentlessly pursue tangible solutions for our consumers, customers, and the enterprise.That ambition requires us to create a modern cloud and data ecosystem - a one of its kind that becomes the neural network of our company. We want you to bring your tech-self to us. We use Python, R, Spark, React, Tableau, Snowflake, Azure, and others to solve our business challenges. You can look forward to high-impact, no bureaucracy, entrepreneurial work – done in small teams – and a unique opportunity to create something bold, something awesome, something inventive -- and something globally impactful.What You’ll DoUX Designer a critical partner in expanding the User Experience practice at Kraft Heinz. As a UX Designer within the Digital Revolution team you will work cross-functionally to drive and deliver a flawless experience across every point of engagement, primarily in the context of enterprise portals, BI platforms and report modeling. You are joining the Design practice during a period of high growth and will help to accelerate the current momentum by building positive partnerships across Engineering, Product, Data Science and Agile.You will Inject design into the product development lifecycle through each stage ideation, concepting, feasibility, development, deployment, QA, analysis.Lead formal usability testing sessions with a broad set of user types.Conduct user research using personas, behavioral archetypes, site maps, user flows, user interviews, card sorting, journey mapping, competitive audits, and market research.Leverage research, gather first-person insights and collaborate with parallel teams when building out wireframes and high-fidelity prototypes for review, stakeholder signoff and handoff to engineering.Relentlessly advocate for elevating the user experience across all touchpoints and position the user at the center of all of our problem-solving sessions.Assist with requirements gathering sessions, IA/sitemap development, user story creation, persona/archetype design, wireframing/prototyping, user research, moderating user-testing sessions (on-site and remote) and more.Who You AreExperience working in UX/UI design roles and evangelizing Design Thinking across multi-disciplinary teams.A critical, confident, and clear voice for UX and design-centered thinking within Kraft Heinz.An outstanding communicator, oral and written.A confident presence when presenting, verbally defending, and compromising on design solutions, embracing an agile, iterative approach to excellence when necessary.A deep-rooted ability to empathize with users.Apply a keen business sense in understanding the balance between perfection and deployment obligations.Proven experience solutioning across devices, frameworks, platforms, responsive states etc.Deep experience working within and contributing to design systems that consistently scale across platforms.A foundational understanding of BI/Analytics, data visualization design and report modeling.Experience with complex prototyping and data visualization designFigma, Adobe Creative Suite, Tableau, PowerBI, React, MicrostrategyWHY US?We're accelerating our ambition to become a best-in-class Digital leader by making data-driven investments that drive smarter business decisions. As the guardians of 200 beloved brands and the creators of innovative products, we're dedicated To Sustainably Grow by Delighting More Consumers Globally. What we build today helps bring joy to customers, consumers, and communities around the world tomorrow. Ready to build the future of food, now? Have a seat at our table and join our Digital Revolution.Ready to help future-proof our legacy? Join our table, and Let's Make Life Delicious!This is a hybrid role - 3 days per week in office.About UsKraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.Why UsWe grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz. Office Collaboration & Hybrid Work EnvironmentWe believe our office environment fuels our collaboration, connection & community as an organization and allows our employees to grow toward greatness. We also believe providing a more flexible and agile model is essential in today’s workplace. A majority of our office-based employees will be able to work remotely for up to two days each week. Additionally, employees who are subject to this hybrid model will be eligible to work from anywhere for up to six weeks in a rolling 12-month period (in maximum two-week increments and according to benefits and tax guidelines). Some jobs may be required to be performed fully in office depending on the role’s responsibilities and requirements.

title: UX Researcher, 2024 Graduate U.S.
description: OverviewWorking at AtlassianAtlassians can choose where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.ResponsibilitiesYour future teamAtlassian is searching for a Research Associate to join our growing team of research experts. Atlassian's mission is to unleash the potential of teams all over the world. You will define and conduct research that not only informs our ultimate mission, but feeds the design, strategy and development of our products and platforms. You will join a smart, passionate team who work together to improve our research craft and help Atlassian build better experiences for our customers.Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN, or H-1B student graduates at this time.QualificationsWhat you'll doReport to a Research Manager and conduct generative and evaluative research to help improve our products and platforms.Partner with teams such as product management, design, marketing, data science, and engineering to influence product and platform decisions and direction.Collaborate with other research specialities to bring depth to your insights.Communicate research insights in credible, creative ways to help teams understand the needs of our customers.Your backgroundPursuing a masters degree in Human Computer Interaction, Psychology, Anthropology, or similarExperience with qualitative (and some quantitative) research methods, along with knowledge of when, why, and how to apply them. We value your ability to be creative when thinking about the research problem you're trying to solve.Proficient in data management and data analysis. We will look for engaging techniques for sharing research insights.Currently enrolled in a full-time Masters program and graduating by June 2024Please note: At this time, this role is only open to entry-level candidates with less than a year of professional experience (this does not include internships/co-ops)CompensationAt Atlassian, we strive to design equitable and explainable compensation programs. To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. Base pay within the range is ultimately determined by a candidate's skills, expertise, or experience.RoleIn the United States, we have three geographic pay zones. For this role, our current base pay ranges for new hires in each zone are:Zone A: $112,500 - $150,000Zone B: $101,300 - $135,000Zone C: $93,500 - $124,600This role may also be eligible for benefits, bonuses, commissions, and equity.Please visit go.atlassian.com/payzones for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones. However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter.Our Perks & BenefitsAtlassian offers a variety of perks and benefits to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health coverage, paid volunteer days, wellness resources, and so much more. Visit go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits to learn more.About AtlassianAt Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.To provide you the best experience, we can support with accommodations or adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process. Simply inform our Recruitment team during your conversation with them.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit go.atlassian.com/crh .

title: Content Designer
description: Content designers at Meta craft simple, straightforward and human experiences. Approaching design through the lens of language, we leverage our expertise in user experience design, design thinking and product strategy. Come join our team to create and shape great, intuitive products and services used by billions of people around the world every day.You’ll be expected to design and deliver product flows, new features, in-product language, content frameworks, navigation, product naming and more, for platforms including mobile, desktop, AR/VR, hardware and voice. The Meta Content Design team is one of the largest and most established in the world, and includes people at various stages in their careers and from a range of backgrounds.Content Designer Responsibilities:Design, write, edit and test clear, compelling in-product language to help users and teams meet their goals. This includes product flows, interface language, education materials, product names, navigational nomenclature, terminology, taxonomies and other content across Meta products and experiences.Apply systems thinking to the product, whether it’s defining extensible design system guidance, conducting audits of existing experiences or creating information architecture.Use your familiarity with how code works in software. This may involve doing things like reviewing code to ensure the in-product language is as intended, or creating the logic to personalize the experience for a user.Give and solicit feedback from your UX design peers in service of building the best products.Create or contribute to high-fidelity design mocks using Figma.Collaborate daily with peers across disciplines, including engineering, design, research, marketing and data science, to take products from conception to launch.Partner with our internationalization team to ensure product experiences are of the highest quality in every language.Demonstrate sound judgment and help shape product narratives, along with team direction and strategy.Independently and proactively identify and work on projects that span multiple teams.Minimum Qualifications:Experience in simplifying and communicating complex ideas to broad audiences in a compelling way.5+ years’ experience in UX writing.Examples of finished wireframes, or design mocks co-authored using design tools, that have been used to drive decision-making within a team.Familiarity with tools for managing and updating content at scale.Examples of work in design systems and systems thinking.Demonstrated experience leading projects with minimal direction and handling a large degree of ambiguity.About Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

title: Innovation Consultant (Associate)
description: Join us to imagine and create tomorrow's products, services and businesses - and create them today.Board of Innovation is a global independent collective of strategists, designers, and tech pioneers. We lead the charge in AI-powered innovation and we're looking for an Innovation Consultant (Associate)/ Associate Business Designer in NYC, who is driven by our resolute mission to make what life needs next.Our culture is forward-thinking, built on the pillars of intellectual curiosity, an originator & experimenter mindset, all fueled by the power of AI and fortified by exceptional business acumen.Our values should tell you something about how we roll and we look for genuine alignment on these - it's a non negotiable. Make it personal: help others. Be yourself. Leave your ego at the door Make it better: think, and think again. Raise the bar. Listen, learn, share, repeat Make it happen: be entrepreneurial. No buzzwords, no theater. Ideas are nice, but impact is everythingWhat's in it for you?You'll be working with a global, diverse team of smart, creative people with hacker mindsets and an entrepreneurial approach. Check out some of our team on Linkedin, to spark your curiosity - Geoff, Monte, Natasha, Kahini . If you like a challenge this is the place for you.You'll get in front of our clients from day one. This is a key role in our team and you'll be instrumental in contributing to successful client outcomes and deliverables. If you're passionate about the limitless possibilities of AI in driving innovation, we should definitely talk!What does success look like from the inside?Our entrepreneurial talent is one of the biggest drivers for our growth which doesn't vibe too well with very rigid job descriptions. At the same time we want to be transparent around what's expected of this role. That's why we've included our success factors, a framework that serves as a foundation for setting clear role expectations and allowing our people to grow. We anticipate that you will be acknowledged by both your clients and colleagues as a valuable contributor, showcasing a genuine spirit of experimentation in all matters pertaining to AI, strategy, and the development of value propositions. Project contribution and ownership: You work closely with our project teams and make contributions with excellent attention to detail, accuracy, deadlines and energy Project management: We expect you to effectively prioritize your own work and keep the multidisciplinary team (other business designers, digital experimenters, designers & client stakeholders) informed on the progress Self driven learning: You keep yourself up to date in strategy, value proposition & our offering. You actively participate on projects and contribute to overall success of the team. Business development: You contribute to business development efforts by supporting deal teams in preparing presentation decks, desk research, sharing/liking posts on LinkedIn, blogposts etcDoes this sound like you?We recognize everyone has a unique journey. We love that. But if you are still wondering if this is your dream job, then consider if this is you:You bring in 1-2 years of relevant experience in an innovation / strategy / AI agencyYou are eligible to work in the US and you're excited to work from our New York office a few times a weekYou are interested in designing and executing impactful evaluative and generative experiments using digital tools. You have experience setting up quantitative testsYou are familiar with UX research and you have some experiences validating business hypotheses through qualitative research and digital experimentsYou identify strongly with our mission, values and culture This is an exhaustive list, please apply even if you don't tick all of these boxes. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives, recognizing that a diverse workforce is fundamental to achieving our mission and goals.And finally, some things you should know about how we workBoard of Innovation an independent agency, committed to open source - all our insights are available on our website and you can download as many as you like to use in any way you like. That should tell you something about how we think about Innovation - what we do goes beyond frameworks and methodologies. We hire people who think bigger than the box and don't need the template - the original thinkers. Our consultants are at the forefront of using Artificial Intelligence to imagine and create products, services, and businesses that stick. We look for fast learners who can see a client problem from a different angle and find smarter ways to answer strategic questions.Join us to imagine and create tomorrow's products, services and businesses - and create them today.

title: UX/UI Designer
description: About The OpportunityUX/UI DesignerJob DescriptionNortheastern’s Marketing department is looking for a highly collaborative and talented UX/UI Designer to join our team. As a UX/UI Designer, you take an active role in the discovery, concepting and implementation of user experiences across university digital assets, serving a spectrum of audience segments. You will collaborate with cross-disciplinary team members and university stakeholders to create optimized, cross-platform user-centered experiences.We’re looking for the complete UX package with an emphasis on intuitive experiences and sophisticated visual design skills.Primary Responsibilities IncludeAnalyze user needs and align with business objectivesDesign intuitive and compelling interfaces optimized across devices Create personas, journey maps, wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows, site maps, prototypes, and mockups/comps Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-offCollaborate with team members, university colleagues and stakeholders to identify opportunities for integrated user experiencesParticipate in presentations of designs for review and approval at various levels across the universityMaintain and extend Northeastern brand identity systemsRepresent UX/UI best practices across the universityQualifications3+ years’ experience in UX/UI design, interaction design, information architecture or other related disciplines – key visual UI design eye a mustAbility to solve complex interactions and demonstrate a high level of critical thinking skillsWell-versed in Design Thinking principles and cross platform design best practicesA comprehensive portfolio that demonstrates intuitive and compelling designsSelf-starter with a track record of delivering quality work under deadlinesExtraordinary attention to details and craftsmanshipNatural collaborator with excellent interpersonal skillsBachelor’s DegreeResponsibilityLead role in the discovery, UX/UI design and implementation across university assets, serving a spectrum of audience segmentsAnalyze user needs and align with business objectivesDesign intuitive and compelling interfaces optimized across devices Create personas, journey maps, wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows, site maps, prototypes, and mockups/comps Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-offCollaborate with team members, university colleagues and stakeholders to identify opportunities for integrated user experiencesParticipate in presentations of designs for review and approval at various levels across the universityMaintain and extend Northeastern brand identity systemsRepresent UX/UI best practices across the universityPosition TypeInformation TechnologyAdditional InformationNortheastern University considers factors such as candidate work experience, education and skills when extending an offer.Northeastern has a comprehensive benefits package for benefit eligible employees. This includes medical, vision, dental, paid time off, tuition assistance, wellness & life, retirement- as well as commuting & transportation. Visit https://hr.northeastern.edu/benefits/ for more information.Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.To learn more about Northeastern University’s commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see www.northeastern.edu/diversity.
