title: Designer, Global Creative Design- Origins
description: Position OverviewSupport the Associate Design Director and Executive Director, Global Design in the 360 creative concept, development, and execution of omnichannel content (with an emphasis in video) including campaign activations, in-store visual merchandising collateral, social content, and online/digital for global programs and special projects.We are looking for someone with a strong affinity to nature who is curious, creative, and driven to uncover new insights and possibilities through exploration and experimentation. The ideal candidate will contribute to the development of innovative solutions that draw on the wisdom of nature while also leveraging cutting-edge scientific knowledge and technology. This individual should be deeply inspired by the beauty and complexity of the natural world.Primary Responsibilies Partner with Design Director and Associate Design Director on design and junior art direction for campaigns and special projects. Collaborate with copywriters. Work with the team to concept and executed full campaigns that include full 360 content. Execute against the entirety of the campaign that includes design for social, digital, and print including pre- and post-production, presentations, and artwork release. Participate in weekly creative department status and work closely with other members of the creative and creative operations team. Collaborate with the global marketing and social teams. Ensure brand guidelines are adhered to. React to social trends and help to continually evolve the brand’s platforms. Maintain strong working knowledge of Origins brand, its heritage, customers, products, and retail environments.QualificationsQUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE 1-3 years of related experience with strong design and junior art direction background. Ability to organize and manage multiple projects to meet deadlines. Proficiency in InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, AfterEffects, and Premiere Has a Passion that is rooted in the cultural zeitgeist. Strong interest in social content. Strong typography skills. Strong communication skills to be able to present to their manager. Problem Solver. Team Player.The anticipated base salary range for this position is $59,500 to $89,000. Exact salary depends on several factors such as experience, skills, education, and budget. Salary range may vary based on geographic location. In addition to base salary, this position is eligible for participation in a highly competitive bonus program with possibility for overachievement based on performance and company results.In addition, The Estée Lauder Companies offers a variety of benefits to eligible employees, including health insurance coverage, wellness and family support programs, life and disability insurance, retirement savings plans, paid leave programs, education-related programs, paid holidays and vacation time, and many others. Many of these benefits are subsidized or fully paid for by the company.Job Creative / DesignPrimary Location US-NY-New YorkJob Type StandardSchedule Full-timeShift 1st (Day) ShiftJob Number 239092We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. It is Company's policy not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances. The Company will endeavor to provide a reasonable accommodation consistent with the law to otherwise qualified employees and prospective employees with a disability and to employees and prospective employees with needs related to their religious observance or practices. Should you wish to apply for this position or any other position with the Company and you believe you require assistance to complete an application or participate in an interview, please contact USApplicantAccommodations@Estee.com.

title: UI Designer
description: Qué estamos buscando?En Paisanos buscamos personas con mucho empuje y pasión para sumarse a un equipo con ganas de crecer, aprender y ser protagonistas de la evolución de los productos digitales a través de la tecnología, el diseño y la creatividad.Si querés saber más acerca de quiénes somos y qué hacemos, podés leer nuestro Handbook .Qué define a un Paisano?La Cultura, Por Eso Es Muy Importante QueSeas muy abierto a dar y recibir feedback franco y transparente (solo podemos mejorar si nos decimos sin vueltas lo que creemos que hay que cambiar).No tengas miedo a equivocarte. Estamos a favor de equivocarse, hacelo mucho, lo antes posible y tratá de no repetir el error.Seas auto-didacta y nunca pares de aprender.Respetes la opinión de los demás y tengas empatía, pero que defiendas a muerte un camino si crees que es el correcto.También creemos que un buen diseño es la mejor forma de resolver problemas a través de la tecnología, por eso es importante que tengas muy buen criterio estético y seas super exigente con este aspecto.Qué vas a tener que hacer?Involucrarte en el problema de negocio que el cliente quiere resolver y con el mercado en el que opera con el fin de interpretar las necesidades del mismo y poder así, diseñar un producto digital que resuelva un problema real, sea fácil de usar y haga la diferencia desde lo estético.Vas a tener que trabajar codo a codo con todo el squad de Paisanos asignado al proyecto en el que estés, con el fin de que el diseño cumpla con los requerimientos funcionales del producto, y que el equipo de desarrollo pueda implementarlo en tiempo y forma.Tareas a realizarRequisitosTengas experiencia diseñando interfaces de productos digitales web y mobile (no importa cuántos años, lo importante es que sepas y demuestres criterio).Tengas muy buenas habilidades de comunicación y estés abierto a recibir feedback sobre tu diseño.Sepas presentar tu diseño al cliente, siendo claro, conciso y explicando el por qué de las decisiones que tomaste.Tengas el mindset de "pixel perfect". Si algo no está en su lugar, es parte de tu responsabilidad hablar con el equipo de desarrollo para que lo corrijan.Tengas muy buena capacidad de organización.Manejes muy bien herramientas de diseño como Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, etc.Tengas experiencia armando prototipos en herramientas como Marvel, Framer X, Invision Studio, Principle, Protopie, etc.Seas muy curioso, te encante estar al día en cuanto a tendencias de tecnología y diseño de productos, y te apasione trabajar en equipo.Tengas la capacidad de ser muy empático con tus compañeros y con el cliente.Sepas de metodologías ágiles.No hace falta que sepas todo, siempre y cuando demuestres la capacidad de aprender lo que te falta 🤓Beneficios💻 Trabajo remoto: Solo en algunas ocasiones particulares te pedimos que vayas a la oficina (que queda en Colegiales), el resto de los días podés trabajar desde tu casa, lo que importa es que lo hagas desde donde seas más productivo.🏥 Obra social: Swiss Medical Plan SMG20. ‍ 🏝️ 3 semanas de vacaciones: 2 para que te tomes cuando quieras, y una que es a fin de año en las fiestas donde todos los Paisanos nos tomamos 1 semana para descansar y recargar pilas.🧘 Flexiblidad: trabajamos por objetivos y sabemos que las personas tienen una vida personal que atender. Mientras te organices y cumplas tus objetivos, todo ok.🤓 Bonificación en clases de inglés.🎂 Día libre por cumpleaños.✈️ Viajes con parte del equipo con el fin de hacer una semana de team-building y conocer lugares nuevos, trabajando de forma remota desde alguna provincia de Argentina.💸 Ajustes trimestrales por inflación, incluyendo 1 instancia de evaluación de desempeño donde se contempla el cambio de seniority.💰 Bono anual por performance de Paisanos e individual a cobrar en 2 partes, en los trimestres en los que no hay aguinaldo (Marzo y Septiembre)Aplicar

title: User Experience (UX) Research Intern
description: Location:1000 Red River StreetAustin , Texas, 78701United StatesUser Experience (UX) Research InternRequisition ID: req930 Employment Type: Unclassified Temporary Full-Time (UFP)Division: Communications Compensation: 19.50 - 21.00, Hourly WageLocation: TRS Job Closing: December 1st at 5:00 pm, CSTWho We AreService, Respect, and Connection are core to the individual and collective TRS experience. We know that great service rests on a foundation of relationships that connect us all to an empowering and rewarding career. At TRS, we’re inspired by our diverse community who bring authenticity and commitment to our mission to improve the retirement security of public education employees and retirees throughout Texas.As a group of achievers, we tap collaboration and innovation to raise the bar in performance, administering and counseling pensions and healthcare benefits to ensure certainty for the future of our members. We invite you to join us, where both personal and career growth are respected and where you can make a difference in our members’ lives every day. Note: This position is a temporary, limited term assignment.The User Experience (UX) Research Intern performs entry-level project work related to their field of study and agency communications. Work involves supporting agency operations with a primary focus on gaining practical work experience and business skills for personal development or to satisfy educational requirements. The incumbent will proactively work with the Communications team, Intern Cohort, and agency employees.This position will start June 5th and will end August 9th 2024.Salary Will Be Dependent Upon Education LevelUndergraduate (Junior or Senior) - $19.50/hourGraduate Student - $21.00/hourUser Experience Research WHAT YOU WILL DO: Assists in defining a comprehensive user experience research plan for the agency website.Identifies best practices for quantitative and qualitative user experience research methods.Designs studies to address agency communication goals and objectives.Facilitates at least one user experience research study.Assists in user journey mapping.General SupportMay assist in researching, compiling, and analyzing data; entering data into spreadsheets, databases, and other automated applications; and preparing complex queries and reports.May review forms, correspondence, reports, and other documents for completeness and acceptability.May assist in reviewing and analyzing agency policies, procedures, and forms and recommending changes to improve efficiency and effectiveness.Assists in completing special projects.Performs related work as assigned.Required EducationWHAT YOU WILL BRING:Currently enrolled in and actively attending an accredited college or university as an undergraduate student with a declared major in Information Studies/Science, Statistics, Journalism, Communications, Graphic Design, Psychology, Computer Science, or related program ; ORCurrently enrolled in and actively attending an accredited college or university as a graduate student (Master or Doctoral) in a(n) Information Studies/Science, Statistics, Journalism, Communications, Graphic Design, Psychology, Computer Science, or related program. Applicant will be required to submit a copy of official college transcripts.Required ExperienceExperience with User Experience (UX) research methods and best practices.Required Registration, Certification, Or Licensure None.Preferred QualificationsPortfolio demonstrating UX research project experience.Currently enrolled in and actively attending an accredited college or university as a graduate student (Master or Doctoral) in a(n) Information Studies/Science Journalism, Communications, Graphic Design, Statistics, Psychology, Computer Science, or related program.Letter(s) of recommendation from program professor(s) are strongly encouraged.Experience using Microsoft Office software.Knowledge, Skills, And AbilitiesKnowledge of:User Experience research methods and best practices.Tools used for web and mobile product research.General office practices and procedures.Concepts and practices of proofing, editing, and preparing informational materials.User Experience design.Skill InOrganizing and prioritizing work to manage a high-volume workload in a fast-paced environment, and completing work accurately while meeting deadlines.Conducting data searches and evaluations of large amounts of information, performing complex analysis of the data, and preparing concise and accurate reports and written/oral recommendations.Verbal and written communication of complex information that is accurate, timely, and based on sound judgment.Providing quality customer service.Reviewing documentation; properly applying complex laws, regulations, rules, and policies; and making decisions based on sound judgment.Using a personal computer in a Windows and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel) environment, and accurately performing data entry.Ability ToEstablish and maintain harmonious working relationships with co-workers, agency staff, and other external contacts.Work effectively in a professional team environment.Military Occupational Specialty (MOS) CodesVeterans, Reservists or Guardsmen with experience in the Military Occupational Specialty ( http://www.hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_AdministrativeSupport.pdf ) along with the minimum qualifications listed above may meet the minimum requirements and are highly encouraged to apply. Please contact Talent Acquisition at careers@trs.texas.gov with questions or for additional information.To view all job vacancies, visit www.trs.texas.gov/careers or www.trs.csod.com/careersite .For more information, visit www.trs.texas.gov .

title: UX Researcher, Qualitative
description: Our UX Research team is designing for the global diversity of human needs, which requires us to deeply understand the behaviors of the people behind them. Our researchers tackle some of the most complex challenges to gain deeper insights into how people interact with each other and the world around them, and work collaboratively to contribute new ideas to products that impact the experiences of billions of people on a global scale. This job description represents different full-time roles across Meta.We use a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods to accomplish our goals, including surveys, focus groups, field studies, usability tests, and 1:1 interviews. We value a diverse range of perspectives and stem from many different backgrounds.We’re looking for excellent communicators who are knowledgeable about research devoted to understanding people, and curious about the relationship between technology and society. They will also need to be comfortable in a fast-moving organization, open-minded about learning new research methods, committed to high-quality and rigorous research, and focused on influencing the future of Meta.UX Researcher, Qualitative Responsibilities:Work closely with product and business teams to identify research topicsAct as a thought leader in the domain of research, while advocating for the people who could use our productsDesign and execute end-to-end custom primary research using a wide variety of methodsDesign studies that address both user behavior and attitudesAbility to work independently and autonomouslyEffectively manage and prioritize research plans through ambiguous and fast-changing environments, align and efficiently execute critical insights and work with a large group of stakeholdersCommunicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative waysWork cross-functionally with design, product management, content strategy, engineering and marketingGenerate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designsMinimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree with 10+ years’ of relevant experience in user experience, applied research and/or product research and development or a Master’s degree and 8+ years’ relevant experience, or PhD and 5+ year relevant experienceExperience conducting In-Depth Interviews or Focus Groups and Concept Testing or Usability TestingInterest in and experience executing hands-on, primary researchExperience translating research findings into strategic narrativesPreferred Qualifications:Degrees in a human behavior related field, such as Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Sociology, Communication, Information Science, Media Studies, Computer Science, or EconomicsExperience with consumer products, consumer insights, or product developmentAbout Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

title: Product Design Intern - Summer 2024
description: Mark43 is approved to hire in 39 states, including AL, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, IL, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, OH, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WV, and WI. Before applying to a remote role, please ensure that you are able to perform the position in one of the states listed above. State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.About Mark43Mark43's mission is to empower communities and their governments with new technologies that improve the safety and quality of life for all. We build powerful, scalable, and elegant software that sets a new design standard for the tools our first responders rely on.About The JobCome join our design team as a paid intern, and learn what it's like to design software for police officers, detectives, and 911 dispatchers. You'll be working with close-knit, highly skilled and passionate designers, as well as some of the industry's best product managers and engineers. As an intern at Mark43, you'll be responsible for tackling real problems we need solved while working with real customers. Some examples of past intern work has included: a real-time map for dispatchers to keep track of first responders on the street, a dark mode color theme to keep first responders safe at night, native mobile active event list, and a command line feature to control our dispatch software. Get ready to be challenged and grow!We are primarily looking for students graduating in the Spring/Summer of 2024/2025. Our internship program will be running from June 4th, 2024 - August 30, 2024.Candidate must be able to work 2-3 days a week out of our NYC office location.What You Can Expect To AchieveOwn the end-to-end design process while collaborating with product, engineering and your design mentor Work on challenging, meaningful, real-world projects Work on complex UX and UI problems Practice accessible and inclusive design using and contributing to our design system Work as an end-to-end designer while practicing design techniques across the entire design process (user research, validation, workflow diagramming, wire-framing, prototyping, etc.) Build skills and grow with mentorship and feedback from the design team What We Expect From YouUnderstanding of design fundamentals (layout, hierarchy, typography, common UI patterns) Experience making design decisions amidst constraints and/or with cross-functional teammates (ie, product, engineering, research, etc) Interest in utilizing qualitative and quantitative research to inform design decisions Willingness to justify and defend design decisions to stakeholders Self-motivated (we love side projects), curious, detail oriented, and committed to quality Willingness to empathize with users who may be unlike yourself Interest in technology, civic, and public safety issues Have a portfolio of work that demonstrate your process as well as showcasing completed design solution What You Can Expect From UsMentorship on becoming a great product designer Building mission critical and socially responsible software to enable first responders to better serve their communities Constructive and actionable feedback on your work from designers at all levels Gain experience at the arising intersection of design/technology/government Read more about our work from our design team on Medium:My On-Site Research Experience as a Design Intern at Mark43 My Remote Product Design Internship Experience at Mark43 Records Privacy: Designing for our Users and their Communities Refreshing design principles for a growing gov tech startup We feel passionately about equal pay for equal work, and transparency in compensation is one vehicle to achieve that. Compensation for this role is paid at an hourly rate of $40 per hour.Mark43 is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. As part of this commitment, we will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed, please email recruiting@Mark43.com requesting the accommodation.

title: UX Designer New York City (3 days per week onsite)
description: UX DesignerLocation: New York City (3 days per week onsite)Duration: 6-12+mthMust HavePlease be aware that candidates cannot be submitted without a portfolio Fluency in Figma, Sketch and InVisionSenior UX DesignerOverviewThe Wealth Management UX team builds digital experiences that help our clients manage their finances and monitor their investments easily. We design for two key user bases: our clients, and our Financial Advisors, whose job it is to guide clients through financial milestones big and small. Our growing team of designers and researchers bring an entrepreneurial spirit to a leading global financial firm. We employ design thinking methods and a user-centered approach to solve real business problems. If you can bring clarity to complexity, design holistically in an immense product ecosystem, and have gone the extra mile to create delight, we want you!Once Here You Will... Under the guidance of the Lead UX Designer, strategize and execute the product vision by being heavily involved in the end-to-end product design process Gather requirements on the underlying needs and motivation of our users to ensure we achieve business goals Design an intuitive and elegant experience that empowers Financial Advisors to make confident financial decisions Work closely with our research team to synthesize qualitative and quantitative data and make value-driven design decisions which then translate into clear, simple UIs Conduct basic user feedback sessions with users identified by the business or the UX research team Create and present a variety of design deliverables (sketches, wireframes, user flows and prototypes) in a way that engenders confidence in you and your solutions within the team and the greater organization Design holistic solutions that integrate seamlessly into our Wealth Management product ecosystem Design and deliver responsive/adaptive solutions that are optimized for web and mobile interfaces and partner with engineers to translate designs into successful productsRelevant Experience And Mindset An outstanding portfolio that demonstrates how you have created experiences that solved business and user needs 5-7 years of experience as a UX designer as a key contributor to the success of products that have launched Bachelor's degree in design or related field; master’s degree is a plus Fluency in Figma, Sketch and InVision You thrive in a collaborative, explorative environment and value being on a diverse team that you can bounce ideas off of, get critical feedback from, and unite to mature design thinking in a large organization You practice active listening and contribute to group situations (brainstorms, audits, critiques, whiteboard sessions, etc.) You have a high tolerance for complex projects with high levels of ambiguity and you are resilient in the face of obstacles You have a relentless desire to validate assumptions and uncover a problems’ root cause by testing, learning and iterating You constantly seek opportunities to evangelize and promote design thinking in a large organizationThanks & RegardsSuhil MohdAccount ManagerUS Direct- 469-813-5703Email : suhil@anveta.com| URL: http://www.anveta.comAddress: 1333 Corporate Drive, Suite #108 Irving, TX 75038, USAANVETA, Inc

title: UI/UX Designer / Developer
description: Work with product managers, developers, and business stakeholders to help set product directionDesign advanced data visualizations and/or BI Dashboards to support the needs of internal and external stakeholdersProduce design visualizations that help stakeholders across disciplines understand what the best experience looks like: storyboards, user-flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, etcWork with internal stakeholders to understand their businessCreate flexible designs and work flows that allow the interface to easily adapt and change based on new products delivered.RequirementsIndustry experience includes - 5+ years of related design experience; Working across a large organization with varying technical skill levels. Ability to work deep in the trenches with cross-functional teams on product design and ownershipExperience with - UX research, including planning, designing and facilitating user sessions and client & stakeholder workshops and design sprints, analyzing findings and articulating results Information architecture, user and screen flows, conceptual and detailed wireframing and prototyping Ensure all design documentation is created holistically with the client vision and cross-functional needs Knowledge bases and how to effectively structure them to present the optimal data and results Working in a wide variety of modern design tools like Sketch, Figma, Adobe XD, Marvel Principle, and InVision Reviewing existing systems and processes to identify UX issues and develop UX recommendationsYour online portfolio - Showcases your experience, storytelling and design presentation skills Demonstrates strong design judgement and an ability to solve nebulous UX problems Showcases your projects with a breadth of diverse projects and challenges Focuses on your guiding design principles and techniquesThe ability to - Approach design challenges with curiosity and a willingness to learn Produce "pixel perfect" design files Organize and self-direct to get things done Communicate your ideas in an efficient manner Work independently and in groups as neededPreferred: Experience contracting in agile methodology Qualitative and quantitative research methodologies Experience working in ad-tech or mar-tech Experience with BI & data viz tools like Tableau, Adobe Analytics, Datorama, etc Surface knowledge of HTML5/CSS3 and FE frameworks like Bootstrap, etcExperience working in a consulting environment

title: UX Designer
description: Company DescriptionATPCO is the foundation of flight shopping, providing pricing and retailing data, tools, and services to 500+ airlines, global distribution systems, sales channels, and technology companies. ATPCO links the entire airline community together, collaborating to develop industry standards for airline distribution and end-to-end technology solutions. From shopping to settlement, ATPCO solutions work seamlessly across existing, new, and evolving technologies and methods. Airline-owned and reliably supporting air travel for more than 55 years, ATPCO is everywhere people buy flights.We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, protected military/veteran status, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, or any other legally protected factor.Job DescriptionAs a UX Designer you will work within a development team and collaborate with Product Managers, Engineers, and other business stakeholders to help us build and create simple solutions for the airline industry. We are looking for a seasoned UX thinker with a solid portfolio to help us develop the next iteration of ATPCO’s products. The working hours for this role align with the Eastern Time Zone.You Will:Iterate on current state product experiences by applying user-centered design thinking to optimize existing capabilities and bring new features to usersCollaborate with Product Managers and Engineers throughout the software development process while advocating for user needs to ensure customer outcomes are achievedFacilitate exploratory working sessions with cross-functional team membersApply a build-measure-learn approach and other proven frameworks to product innovationPartner with UX Researchers to validate design decisions and uncover actionable insightsCommunicate the user experience at various stages of the design process with wireframes, flow diagrams, information architecture diagrams, mockups, and high-fidelity prototypesDevelop an operating rhythm with Product and Engineering stakeholders to ensure all perspectives are considered throughout the design processPerform heuristic evaluations, A/B tests, journey mapping, and other UX exercises to obtain learnings that can be integrated into ongoing enhancementsReview user behavior analytics to determine if designs are making a measurable impact on the user experiencePresent in-progress work to UX peers and stakeholders and synthesize feedback into the design path forwardBuild a strong understanding of ATPCO systems, product portfolio, and the airline data ecosystemThe Ideal Candidate:Prior work experience in product design or UXSignificant experience in successfully implementing Best in Class design and development practicesExperience designing across multiple platforms and working with technical and design teams to create user flows, wireframes, and building user interface mockups and prototypesA record of successful delivery of software applications as an individual, team leader, or development managerDemonstrated experience in tracking project and program status, metrics, and analyzing details to determine trends and measuresExperience delivering custom software within a Product focused environmentSolid understanding of Service Oriented Architecture, Continuous Integration, and Delivery environment is preferredPortfolio highlighting multiple projects and direct contributions within those projectsBachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, or related fieldAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: UX Designer w/ Figma, Sketch, InVision
UX Researcher Intern
description: The Summer Internship:At Discord, we are committed to creating a welcoming digital space where friends and communities can hang out together to create memorable experiences. We offer a personalized experience for interns, and our aim is to offer an experience that mimics what it is like to actually work here. We match qualified interns with projects and groups, based on interests and skill sets and fully embed interns within those groups for the summer.Internships are paid and run for (at minimum) 12 weeks, targeting a start date in June 2024 to accommodate varying school calendars.The Team:We are seeking a passionate and proactive UX Researcher Intern to join our dynamic Research team. This position is ideal for a college student who possesses an unceasing curiosity, particularly focused on systems design and the development of innovative digital products.What you'll be doing:Work closely with researchers, product managers, data scientists, and designers to inform critical Product (business and design) decisionsParticipate in research scoping, recruitment, execution, and implementationLearn to leverage different research methods, tools, and data types to create and communicate a holistic understanding of people and experiencesDevelop artifacts like screeners, scripts, templates, and reports/presentationsInspire new ideas through design thinking exercises, like workshopsWhat you'll bring to the table:Currently enrolled in an undergraduate, Master's, or PHD course of studyAwareness of data and participant privacy best practicesExperience with qualitative and/or quantitative research methods, along with knowledge of when, why, and how to apply themBasic understanding of UX and service experience design and principlesExperience defining, finding, and communicating with the "right" people for the scope of research, including participants and stakeholdersNice-to-haves: Experience using any of the following tools:Discord!Recruitment (UserTesting, DScout, Respondent IO, User Interviews, Rally)Research (UserTesting, Qualtrics, DScout, Tremendous)Business (G-Suite, Video conferencing, Concord)Qualtrics or related survey toolSalary of $59/hour (undergrad), $69/hour (Master's) and $79/hour (PhD)Note: Disclosure as required by NYC Pay Transparency Law and CO Disclosure as required by sb19-085(8-5-20)Benefits listed below may differ from those available depending on terms of employment*Benefits and PerksComprehensive medical insurance including Health, Dental and Vision (plus up to $20,000 for gender affirmation procedures)Mental health resources and quarterly wellness stipends14+ paid holidays, 4 weeks of PTO + use-what-you-need sick days Paid parental leave (plus fertility, adoption and other family planning benefits)Flexible long-term work options (remote and hybrid)Volunteer time offA diverse slate of Employee Resource Groups Plus commuter contributions and other perks for office-based employeesAbout UsDiscord is a voice, video and text app that helps friends and communities come together to hang out and explore their interests — from artists and activists, to study groups, sneakerheads, plant parents, and more. With 150 million monthly users across 19 million active communities, called servers, Discord has grown to become one of the most popular communications services in the world. Discord was built without selling ads or user data and instead, offers a premium subscription called Nitro that gives users special perks like higher quality streams and fun customizations.We’re working toward an inclusive world where no one feels like an outsider, where genuine human connection is a click, text chat, or voice call away. A place where everyone can find belonging. Challenging? Heck yes. Rewarding? Double heck yes. It’s a mission that gives us the chance to positively impact millions of people all over the world. So if this strikes a chord with you, come build belonging with us!

title: Digital Designer
description: Our StorySimply put, we make great jeans and all the cool stuff you wear with them. And, beyond our devotion to premium denim, we believe in putting people and planet first in everything we do from our commitment to sustainable production to our focus on broadening opportunity and building belonging.Whether you’re taking the first step in your career or are looking for an exciting new opportunity, we have a wide array of challenging and creative roles for you. We foster a collaborative, community-driven and innovative environment in our stores, home office, and distribution and call centers. Want in?We’re proud to have been recognized as an industry leader in:America’s Greatest Workplaces for Diversity (Newsweek, 2023)America’s Greatest Workplaces for Women (Newsweek, 2023)Best Employers for Diversity (Forbes, 2022)Best Employers for New Grads (Forbes, 2022)Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality (The Human Rights Campaign Foundation, 2022)DIGITAL DESIGNER(Reports to VP – Digital Creative)Madewell seeks a highly motivated Digital Designer to work on all aspects of madewell.com. The Digital Designer will be involved in the research and design for emails, monthly site creative, promotional assets, digital marketing campaigns, and UX-led projects. The position is 100% remote with the option of coming into the office on occasion.You’ve got to…Get us – a passion for the brand that shows up in everything you do, everyday. Be a strategic thinker – spend time and energy on what drives the greatest results. Look under rocks, be curious, ask questions and use your smarts to think boldly and do the right thing. Be a team player – cultivate productive relationships with cross-functional business partners. Communicate consistently, with purpose and an understanding of your audience. Be a multi-task master – make quick decisions under tight timelines. Be nimble and comfortable with change. Work independently and take the lead, even when all of the pieces are not in place. Articulate your point of view and have the courage and conviction to stand up for your beliefs. Have a great fashion esthetic and be all over what’s happening in the industry. Always be on, up for anything and ready to have fun along the way. We want you to…Under the guidance of the Digital Creative VP, ensure consistent, clear communication of the Madewell brand in our digital touchpoints. Help develop and execute product and marketing focused concepts in partnership with Madewell brand creative and marketing teams. Partner with copy to create product stories and mini sites. Explore and present new design ideas to Madewell brand creative team. Propose new technology uses, interfaces and functionalities. Partner with the production team to develop and quality control site overhauls on madewell.com. Collaborate with the UX team to ensure projects come to life. Oh, and by the way, you…BS/BA degree or equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform essential functions of the job. 3-4 years of design experience Understanding of the brand, refined taste level Strong formal design and typography skills Knowledge of digital technology and its opportunities and restrictions Understanding of Information Architecture Ability to prioritize and follow through Ability to intuit global design trends Meet creative review and production deadlines Detail oriented and highly organized Proactive, excellent communication skillsWe are committed to affirmatively providing equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, legally protected physical or mental disability or any other basis protected under applicable law.We welcome you to apply, even if you don't check all the boxes. Our passion is scouting life-long learners who are driven by curiosity, and who feel connected to our brands and share our desire to make an impact. We’re always seeking bright new talent who leverage their unique experiences to discover, grow and evolve with our teams.Benefits + PerksHealth & Well-being - Eligible associates and family members receive medical, dental, prescription and vision insurance, family planning (fertility, adoption & surrogacy support), fitness discounts, medical travel and more. Associate Discount - We love our products just as much as you do! That’s why we offer a great associate discount across all of our brands (J.Crew, J.Crew Factory, and Madewell). Flex Fridays - In addition to our hybrid work model, we also close our office at 1:00 PM every Friday year-round. Community Impact - We support the communities where we live and work through our philanthropic efforts and the J.Crew Cares Program. Winter Break - In addition to our PTO package, J.Crew Group offers a winter break at the end of December to eligible full-time associates at the Home Office to provide time to refresh and recharge. Note: Availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to work location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements.Salary Range: $64,200.00 - $77,000.00At J.Crew Group (JCG) we aim to pay competitively for our company’s size and industry. The base salary offered will take into account internal equity and may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region of work premises, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. The base salary is just one component of J.Crew Group’s competitive total rewards strategy that also includes the opportunity for bonus, competitive benefits and perks.One of our core focuses here at JCG is creating a community and culture that builds belonging. We are deeply committed to our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion efforts, and we warmly welcome job applicants of all backgrounds.JCG is proud to affirmatively provide equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or citizenship, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, legally protected physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected under applicable law.

title: Junior Designer
description: Junior Designer EMPIRE is an independent label, born and bred out of the Bay Area (San Francisco, California). We have grown to become the largest independent record label in the U.S., with a significant global presence covering Africa, Asia, Europe, Australia and North and South America. We keep ourselves busy with a myriad of music-related services, ranging from the creation of original content and goods (e.g., sound recordings, music publishing, merchandise, and virtual goods) as well as the marketing, promotion, distribution, and creation of brand partnerships around the same.What You’ll Be DoingAssisting project managers to ensure artists rollout deadlines are metUsing brand consistent templates for socialsReworking artwork for various social channels Structuring Artist promotional sheetsCutting engaging music video adsPreparing artwork and files for packaged physicals (CD’s, and Vinyls)You’ll alsoCreate cover artwork and animations for a diverse roster of artistsBuilding pixel perfect billboards, posters, and other print specific materialsRequirementsThis is an entry level design position. We don’t expect you to have years of professional experience but we do expect you to have a great attitude and ambition to learn from the other designers. This is not a remote position - You must live in the Bay Area or be willing to relocate (You will be expected to work in our San Francisco office 4 days a week*).We’d like you to have some experience using a range of Adobe programs - photoshop (and you love guides and perfect alignment), as well as some experience with After Effects or Premiere, Illustrator, and InDesign.You have a general understanding of typography. You have an eye for structuring designs so that they are compelling and legible.You're very organized - you name files appropriately (you’re not using final.psd) plus you take the time to label your layers.Some experience with designing for digital platforms (Instagram, email, web).You have the capacity to handle multiple projects at once and see tasks fully through.BONUS POINTS IF….You have a print or animation experience You have experience using Asana You have a degree in Visual Communications or any other related Graphic Design degreeWe offer:Competitive salary commensurate with experienceHealth insurance, vision, and dentalLife Insurance, short-term disability, and long-term disability insurance is provided at no cost to youPaid Holidays and paid time offCompany 401k planCommuter, parking and cell phone allowanceAt Empire Distribution Inc., we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.If you are passionate about music and design, and looking for a challenging role in a fast-paced, innovative environment, apply today. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Designer
description: At Lyft, our mission is to improve people’s lives with the world’s best transportation. We start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.We’re looking for a Designer with impeccable taste and excellent design skills to join our in-house creative team. You’ll work on a range of projects from small email campaigns to semiannual product release campaigns. As a Designer, you’ll develop and iterate on a range of ideas and design solutions beginning at the brainstorming stage of a project, all the way through refinement and execution. You’ll report to the creative director, and work in close partnership with copywriters, producers, developers, marketing stakeholders, project managers, and other cross-functional teammates.In addition to design skills, you’ll need to demonstrate a wide range of soft skills, including collaboration, organization, adaptability, and excellent communication. You’ll bring proactive problem-solving and multiple potential solutions to each assignment.Our team values creative generosity, enthusiasm, and bringing good energy to the task of creating communications that support the company’s business and goals, educate our riders and drivers, and bring joy and inspiration to our audiences.Responsibilities:Create and ensure design consistency and excellence across a variety of deliverables including emails, in-app messages, blog posts, landing pages, and paid media assets.Partner closely with creative directors, marketers, and content strategists to execute first-class work in a fast-paced environment.Champion the Lyft brand style throughout all channels.Synthesize feedback from a variety of stakeholders to create appropriate solutions in the work you produce.Present and advocate for your creative work to a variety of stakeholders. Adapt quickly to incorporate new learnings and business updates into your creative and design work.Own your own creative projects from briefing through concepting, execution, and delivery, with support and guidance from creative directors.Create and organize meticulous design files for ease of collaboration.Bring excellent creative and design solutions to each project.Experience:4+ years experience at a design studio, agency or in-house design departmentA strong portfolio that demonstrates your strategic, conceptual, and design skills through visually-compelling work.Mastery of composition, typography, color, and imageryMastery of design tools: Figma, Illustrator, Photoshop (After Effects is a plus)Solid understanding of UX, web, responsive design, email, video, 3D, and animationA growth mindsetAbility to multitask, prioritize, and meet deadlines in a fast paced environmentAbility to be detailed in your execution, but flexible in your approachStrong interpersonal and communication skillsYou should be a Lyft user/believer :)Benefits:Great medical, dental, and vision insurance optionsMental health benefitsFamily building benefitsIn addition to 12 observed holidays, salaried team members have unlimited paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off401(k) plan to help save for your future18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligiblePre-tax commuter benefitsLyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership ProgramLyft is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Starting in September 2023, this role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year. The expected range of pay for this position in the New York City area is $94,500 - $105,000. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Range is not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.

title: UX/UI Designer
description: Who We AreAroma360 is a boutique Scent Marketing and Branding company that specializes in providing the highest-quality essential oil-based scenting solutions to businesses and individuals all around the world. As the only full-service scent company, Aroma360 guides clients from concept and development to strategic implementation while priding themselves with exceptional customer service every step of the way. Hotel Collection is a subsidiary of Aroma 360, it's the lifestyle brand of Aroma360.Job SummaryWe are looking for a talented and experienced Shopify UI/UX Designer to join our team. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in designing user-friendly and aesthetically pleasing e-commerce websites on the Shopify platform.ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop and implement user-centered design solutions for Shopify websites. Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups to effectively communicate design concepts. Conduct user research and testing to gather insights and validate design solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers and product managers, to ensure that design solutions are feasible and meet project requirements. Stay current with industry trends and technology advancements related to Shopify and e-commerce design. RequirementsProven experience as a Shopify UI/UX Designer. Strong portfolio demonstrating a deep understanding of Shopify and e-commerce design. Strong understanding of user-centered design principles, user research, and testing methodologies. Proficient in wireframing and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Figma, or similar. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present and defend design decisions. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines. Salary & Benefits$75K-$85K Based on experienceMedical, Dental, Vision401kPaid time offEmployee product discountBeautiful, modern, luxury officeAmazing growth environment and fun cultureSchedule & LocationOffice location: Wynwood- Miami, FLSchedule: Monday – FridayHours: 8:30a – 5:30pOur MissionThe foundation of Aroma360 is built on two primary principles — to provide a healthy scenting solution for homes and businesses, and to educate people about the incredible benefits of Aromachology. Through the incorporation of our high-quality oils, we strive to not only create aromatic sanctuaries but also to preserve the naturally occurring therapeutic properties. Whether it be incorporating a scent to stimulate sales, enhance perceived value or to increase feelings of trust and calmness – scent is a powerful tool that is widely underused.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: UX Research Intern (2024)
description: At Lyft, our mission is to improve people’s lives with the world’s best transportation. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.Lyft is seeking a qualitative User Experience Research Intern to join our team, which aspires to elevate the user experience for our drivers and riders across 300+ cities nationwide. You will conduct research studies, as well as participate in studies alongside more senior researchers from which you’ll gain strong mentorship. You will partner with Design, Product Management, Analytics, and Engineering in order to derive deep insights about our users’ behaviors and attitudes, and communicate results and actionable recommendations across the company.Interns contribute to user-facing products, working side-by-side with top User Experience Research team members in the industry while having autonomy from the get-go. Lyft fosters a collaborative environment in the office, so there's always a sharp mind eager to hear about your next idea. So what's yours?Responsibilities:Design and conduct studies across key Lyft product areas -- independently and in conjunction with more senior researchers. You will utilize methods such as ethnographic & field research, diary studies, surveys, user/usability testing (remote and in-person), guerrilla research, and any other methods you find impactfulReview, analyze, and communicate qualitative and/or quantitative data to generate tactical and strategic insights, as well as actionable recommendations which drive product innovation and design improvements for usersExperience:Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S., or PhD degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Anthropology, Design, Psychology, Cognitive Science, or a related field, with a graduation date between December 2024 and Summer 2025 (required)Available during Summer 2024 for an internshipExtraordinary organizational skills and meticulous eye for detailStrong listening and analytical skills; proactive troubleshooterTeam player with excellent written & verbal communication skillsEnthusiasm for a collaborative, highly energetic, fun and fast-paced environmentExperience as a researcher and/or research coordinator for qualitative research studies or school-based research projects, including usability/user testing, surveys, field research, or user interviewsBonus Points:Research experience with mobile technologyExperience conducting qualitative research in applied research settings, ideally within a Product organizationExperience designing surveys and experimental research, and analyzing large datasets using appropriate statistical methodsExperience using Qualtrics or SurveyMonkeyExperience cleaning, handling, and transforming data in Microsoft Excel and/or Google SheetsExperience with SQL, R, and/or other data analysis software (e.g., SPSS)Experience with research participant recruitment and management practicesDesign thinking, visual communication, information design, or wireframing skillsBenefits:Great medical, dental, and vision insurance optionsMental health benefitsIn addition to holidays, interns receive 2 days paid time off and 3 days sick time off401(k) plan to help save for your futurePre-tax commuter benefitsLyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership ProgramLyft is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Starting in September 2023, this role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Thursdays and a team-specific third day. The expected range of pay for this position in the San Francisco Bay Area, Seattle, and NYC areas is $52-$62/hour USD. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.

title: UI/UX Designer
description: Who We Are:The food industry has struggled to affordably & effectively root out foodborne illness. PathSpot was created with public health and food safety in mind. Our products detect foodborne illnesses contaminants in real time across the world, improving both customer and employee health within leading enterprise brands.Our team values customer-centric thinking, fast development times, and AI-driven insights across the SafetySuite products. With offices in New York City and Dallas, PathSpot has raised +$20M in venture funding to date. Together, let’s build a smarter, safer, more efficient kitchen.Team Description:The product engineering team’s mission is to deliver revolutionary products that exceed our customer needs, paving the path for interconnected products that collect and analyze health & safety data to streamline the way industries operate and serve. As a team, we have a diverse set of skills and love to pick up new ones. Our goal is to ensure every team member has a chance to contribute and take part in any project they may have an interest in. You'll have an opportunity to be a design leader across our product suite: Mobile Application, Custom Hardware, Web Application and Software Platform.What you’ll do:You will be working closely with a small product and engineering team to design new product features and revamp the design of an existing product team. title: Designer
description: At Lyft, our mission is to improve people’s lives with the world’s best transportation. We start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.We’re looking for a Designer with impeccable taste and excellent design skills to join our in-house creative team. You’ll work on a range of projects from small email campaigns to semiannual product release campaigns. As a Designer, you’ll develop and iterate on a range of ideas and design solutions beginning at the brainstorming stage of a project, all the way through refinement and execution. You’ll report to the creative director, and work in close partnership with copywriters, producers, developers, marketing stakeholders, project managers, and other cross-functional teammates.In addition to design skills, you’ll need to demonstrate a wide range of soft skills, including collaboration, organization, adaptability, and excellent communication. You’ll bring proactive problem-solving and multiple potential solutions to each assignment.Our team values creative generosity, enthusiasm, and bringing good energy to the task of creating communications that support the company’s business and goals, educate our riders and drivers, and bring joy and inspiration to our audiences.Responsibilities:Create and ensure design consistency and excellence across a variety of deliverables including emails, in-app messages, blog posts, landing pages, and paid media assets.Partner closely with creative directors, marketers, and content strategists to execute first-class work in a fast-paced environment.Champion the Lyft brand style throughout all channels.Synthesize feedback from a variety of stakeholders to create appropriate solutions in the work you produce.Present and advocate for your creative work to a variety of stakeholders. Adapt quickly to incorporate new learnings and business updates into your creative and design work.Own your own creative projects from briefing through concepting, execution, and delivery, with support and guidance from creative directors.Create and organize meticulous design files for ease of collaboration.Bring excellent creative and design solutions to each project.Experience:4+ years experience at a design studio, agency or in-house design departmentA strong portfolio that demonstrates your strategic, conceptual, and design skills through visually-compelling work.Mastery of composition, typography, color, and imageryMastery of design tools: Figma, Illustrator, Photoshop (After Effects is a plus)Solid understanding of UX, web, responsive design, email, video, 3D, and animationA growth mindsetAbility to multitask, prioritize, and meet deadlines in a fast paced environmentAbility to be detailed in your execution, but flexible in your approachStrong interpersonal and communication skillsYou should be a Lyft user/believer :)Benefits:Great medical, dental, and vision insurance optionsMental health benefitsFamily building benefitsIn addition to 12 observed holidays, salaried team members have unlimited paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off401(k) plan to help save for your future18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligiblePre-tax commuter benefitsLyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership ProgramLyft is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. title: UX/UI Designer
description: Join us to imagine and create tomorrow's products, services and businesses - and create them today.Board of Innovation is a global independent collective of strategists, designers, and tech pioneers. We lead the charge in AI-powered innovation and we're looking for a UX/UI Designer in NYC, who is driven by our resolute mission to make what life needs next.Our culture is forward-thinking, built on the pillars of intellectual curiosity and an originator & experimenter mindset - all fueled by the power of AI and fortified by exceptional business acumen.Our values should tell you something about how we roll and we look for genuine alignment on these - it's a non negotiable. Make it personal: help others. Be yourself. Leave your ego at the door Make it better: think, and think again. Raise the bar. Listen, learn, share, repeat Make it happen: be entrepreneurial. No buzzwords, no theater. Ideas are nice, but impact is everythingWhat's in it for you?You'll be working with a global, diverse team of smart, creative people with hacker mindsets and an entrepreneurial approach. Check out some of our team on Linkedin, to spark your curiosity - Natasha, Monte, Tasha, Lennert. If you like a challenge this is the place for you.You'll be supporting our team on a broad variety of tasks and projects. This is a key role in our team and you'll be instrumental in creating designs that resonate with our client's customers.Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, internally and with our clients, you will play a key role in the design of products and services. If you're passionate about the limitless possibilities of AI in driving innovation, we should definitely talk!What does success look like from the inside?Our entrepreneurial talent is one of the biggest drivers for our growth which doesn't vibe too well with very rigid job descriptions. At the same time we want to be transparent around what's expected of this role. The below is just an example of what your day to day will look like.Create quick responsive digital prototypes and MVPs with tools like Figma or Adobe XDCreate visual stories: insert infographics, add structure, follow brand guidelines etc. for pitch decks, posts for social media, delivery decks, publications, booklets etcDevelop responsive digital mock-ups of business ideasCreate landing pages (e.g. Instapage, Wordpress etc.)Create A/B tests to assess the appeal and effectiveness of new product and service features or conceptsLeverage Generative AI tools like Midjourney, Stable Diffusion, Dall-E, ChatGpt and many othersCarry out independent design projects with little direction and a strong focus on deliveryUnderstands client needs and propose effective design solutionsDoes this sound like you?We recognize everyone has a unique journey. We love that. But if you are still wondering if this is your dream job, then consider if this is you:You are UX/UI designer, with an educational background in Graphic DesignYou have around 3-6 years of experience encompassing a wide range of digital design tasksYou have worked in an agency / consultancy setting beforeYou are based in NYC and happy to come to our office ~3x times a weekYou have a great understanding of branding and can apply brand guidelines to new contentYou know how to work with InDesign, Miro, Illustrator, Photoshop, Keynote & Figma, Miro, Premiere Pro and basic knowledge of Wordpress are a plus

title: Product Designer
description: About UsWe're on a mission to make it possible for every person, team, and company to be able to tailor their software to solve any problem and take on any challenge. Computers may be our most powerful tools, but most of us can't build or modify the software we use on them every day. At Notion, we want to change this with focus, design, and craft.We've been working on this together since 2016, and have customers like Pixar, Mitsubishi, Figma, Plaid, Match Group, and thousands more on this journey with us. Today, we're growing fast and excited for new teammates to join us who are the best at what they do. We're passionate about building a company as diverse and creative as the millions of people Notion reaches worldwide.Notion is an in person company, and currently requires its employees to come to the office for two Anchor Days (Mondays & Thursdays) and requests that employees spend the majority of their week in the office (including a third day).About The RoleImagine yourself in the 1970s or 80s thinking through how computing should look and feel for people who had never seen one before. That's what we're trying to do at Notion — make software that feels timeless, with the craftsmanship of German cameras, playfulness of Japanese toys, and mass appeal of Coca-Cola. We have no end of fascinating challenges that can only be solved by someone with innate product & UX sense, technical aptitude, great taste, and impeccable craft.What You'll AchieveDesign product concepts that balance vision, craft, speed, and business potential.Craft every detail of new product features, from idea to UX to pixel-perfect execution.Run projects end to end with engineers to drive your vision to the ship line.Partner closely with our Customer Experience, Sales, and Customer Success teams to understand what each of our diverse user segments need, want, and love about Notion. Use this data and acquired intuition to prioritize, plan, and scope our product roadmap.Work with Marketing to devise new ways to tell great stories throughout the user lifecycle, and across our site, product, help guides and other channels.Create new patterns that are intuitive, practical, and convergent. Evolve our design system intentionally as we scale.Skills You'll Need To BringYou have well-rounded skills and experience to run projects independently end to end. 5+ years of working experience.You seek to understand the needs of customers then explore and advocate for the strongest user experiences to solve their problemsYou enjoy untangling vague conceptual problems and have a sharp intuition for the most accessible mental models and flows, so users can immediately start gaining value out of the product.You create clear, intuitive, and visually appealing human interfaces.You care about business needs, implications, and practicality of your designs. You don't get stuck on pretty UI or deep abstractions and can balance between craft, speed, and the bottom line.You have strong beliefs, loosely held. You're a good listener who collaborates well with different stakeholders. You observe and internalize all inputs and feedback to help you reach an optimal decision.You understand how to tell stories using both words and visuals, and strategize the best ways to drive alignment.You value working cross-functionally with project management, engineering, research and data — as well as design peers.Nice To HavesYou've designed and built great tools with small teams in the past.You bring unique strengths and perspectives to the team. We're looking to build a diverse team where our skills and experience can complement each other.You've experienced the pain of fragmented tools and information silos created by them, and have a strong urge to fix it.You're familiar with the work of computing heroes like Douglas Engelbart, Alan Kay, Bret Victor, etc. — and understand why we're big fans.You are a designer who can code!We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our global employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers. If you’re excited about a role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you’re a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making software toolmaking ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.Notion is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Notion considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Notion is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.Notion is committed to providing highly competitive cash compensation, equity, and benefits. The compensation offered for this role will be based on multiple factors such as location, the role’s scope and complexity, and the candidate’s experience and expertise, and may vary from the range provided below. For roles based in San Francisco and New York City, the estimated base salary range for this role is $105,000 - $260,000 per year.

To be a part of living history, with the glory of the past fueling the drive for our fifth Stanley Cup.The New York Islanders Hockey Club is one of the most iconic franchises in professional sports, with a deeply passionate and loyal fan base that is second to none. title: Associate Designer
description: As an Associate Designer at Disney Entertainment, you will be responsible for the assistance of creation, development, and delivery of designs for all things digital, including rich media displays, marketing landing pages, and lifecycle email campaigns. This position works independently on assignments and supplies to group projects when needed. This is a production-heavy role, requiring creatives to have the ability to manipulate key art quickly and with meticulous attention to detail. You can adjust design direction quickly and easily based on feedback and push your creativity and software skills to higher levels, while actively communicating and contributing to phases of a project to maintain the quality of the Disney Entertainment product.This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a collaborative, multi-disciplinary team, pushing the boundaries of entertainment content and technology. If that sounds exciting, we want to hear from you!Along with your application, please submit a portfolio or links to your published work.Responsibilities:Support Senior Designers/Designers with the production of digital marketing assetsEager to learn and provide design solutions based on Creative/Art Directors feedbackDesign pixel-perfect digital marketing assetsStay up to date with the latest design and digital trendsKey art manipulation and Photoshop compositingIteration and versioning of creative assets for global marketing campaignsOrganizing, coordinating, and naming files appropriately for team members, vendors and agency partnersKeep the design standards of the brand at the highest possible levelBasic Qualifications:A portfolio that reflects fundamental graphic design skills with an understanding of message hierarchy, typographic layout, and pixel-perfect Photoshop compositing.The ideal candidate will have 1+ years of experience working as a Digital Production Artist or similar roleExpertise in Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesignMust have digital production skills crafting assets in a fast-paced environmentCommitment, dedication to excellence, and attention to detailAbility to work independently, take direction, and work as part of a teamStrong time management skills with the ability to multitask and meet timelines and deadlinesHas excellent written and verbal communication skillsOnly candidates with portfolios, or examples of their work, will be consideredPreferred Qualifications:Experience in Sketch, Figma, HTML, or CSS a plusCandidates who have experience working on lifestyle brands, entertainment brands, and/or streaming services are a plusPreferred Education:BA/BS in Design, Fine Art, Advertising, or a relevant fieldThe hiring range for this position in New York City, NY is $59,100 to $81,100 per year. title: Nuuly: UX Content Strategist
description: Launching a clothing rental subscription service might seem like a bit of an unusual move for a company known for experiential retail concepts, but it's right in line with our mission since 1970: encouraging customers to express themselves through their wardrobes and the spaces they keep. Our unlike-anywhere-else curation of hundreds of designers and labels—and not just from our own brands—is designed to give you everything you need to get inspired, get creative and explore all the different aspects of your individual style, we're here so you can get dressed the way you want.What it's like to work at Nuuly:We pride ourselves on a relaxed office culture, including a gym and marketplace. Our employees enjoy our beautiful, dog-friendly workplace at the Philadelphia Navy Yard. You'll be part of a close-knit and collaborative environment at Nuuly. We provide competitive compensation and incentive bonuses. Title: UX Content Strategist Reports to: Sr. Manager, UX Design Overview: We are looking for a UX Content Strategist to join our User Experience team. As a member of the team, you will help make sense of user goals and business goals in order to drive UX content decisions across our suite of innovative digital products. You’ll work alongside UX Designers, product, engineering and insights teams to ensure the Nuuly experience is clear and delightful. Responsibilities: Strategize: Distill complex experiences across a range of interconnected products into simple, clear journeys and digital communications that achieve business, brand and customer goals. Proactively seek out opportunities to improve our experience touchpoints and socialize recommendations amongst various stakeholdersCollaborate: Strongly partner cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Customer Success, Marketing, CRM and Customer Success teamsWrite: Ideate, write and govern usable and accessible content for Nuuly's customer-facing web and app experiences, operational communications, FAQs, and internal suite of toolsDeliver: Publish and manage content in a Content Management System (CMS)Govern: Conduct content audits and gap analysis. Manage copy documentation and socialize content guidelines across the business. Ensure consistency, clarity URBN and accessibility across content.Maintain: Ensure all Nuuly experience touchpoints align with standards, Brand guidelines and UX best practices Skills + Attributes:Exceptional written and verbal communication skillsEnjoy working independently, spearheading a domain, and taking initiativeAdaptable and solution-oriented in a fast-paced and shifting environmentSkilled presenter and storyteller who is comfortable leading thought exercises across teamsTechnical competency in an agile environment working with development teams and a CMSKind, empathetic team player who works well with others and connects with the Nuuly customerBasic understanding of UX research, behavioral and motivational principles and biases that might inform content and UX choicesNatural interest in continuous learning, and staying up-to-date on emerging technology, content strategy, UX tools and practices Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience in a related field (ex: User Experience, Human Computer Interaction, Communications, Marketing, Business, Psychology)When applying, please supply a portfolio of UX content strategy work and/or writing samples that demonstrate your ability to write across a variety of digital channels Bonus Qualifications: Previous experience working alongside UX Designers, Product Managers and EngineersTechnical competency in UX tool s such as Figman, Figjam and Zeplin Job Skills: If you are a passionate, self-motivated individual who is willing to build their technical writing chops in a new and innovative product space, you'd make a great addition to the Nuuly UX team. We’re looking for a teammate who loves words, working within complex problem spaces, has a tenacity for learning and collaborating with others and yearns for consistency and clarity in all things.Excellent writing skillsDetail-oriented and thorough, with particular attention to accuracy and organizationBasic understanding of writing best practices and UX design principlesTechnical competencyComfort collaborating with others to achieve a common goal Location: Philadelphia, PA (Hybrid) Urban Outfitters, Inc. celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
